Reviews.Title: “would go back there anytime!”
Reviews.Author: shoppingqueen17
Reviews.Content: nice rooms, very good location ( fontana di trevi, colloseum, piazza navona and the pantheon are in walking distance!), breakfeast on the rooftop with beautiful view and the two best ice cream stores of Rome are just around the corner :D

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: PerthTraveller_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in early January, coincidentally at the time of the post New Year sales! Staff were very helpful, and unobtrusive. Location is fantastic, right in the centre of Rome, walking distance to Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, just around the corner from Pantheon. Room was very large and bathroom was very modern and new. The hallways etc look a bit tired, but they are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Some service not as old as expected.”
Reviews.Author: DrCart
Reviews.Content: Great location - even when parliament sitting and news crews fill the piazza - some action from political protesters but not disruptive! Good restaurants and access to main shopping area nearby. Most staff were very friendly and helpful but not all - one or two made it clear they were not impressed by non-Italian tourists ...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, excellent breakfast on rooftop”
Reviews.Author: saintex13
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Rom and stayed at this hotel. We didn't expect because we had heard that hotel standards in Italy are not the best. We got disappointed in a good way, had a large room with all facilities needed. The highlight was a very good breakfast buffet on the rooftop where one has a great view all over Rome. The location is a big advantage, all sights are in walking distance and an area with plenty of restaurants is around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location spoiled by poor staff/attitude”
Reviews.Author: AndrewCov
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends from Arizona for four nights. We have visited Rome at least a dozen times but thought we would try a new location. Hotel is in a great location, our room was excellent only marred by noise from protesters re Mr. Berlesconi. Breakfast room and views excellent. Reception staff exceptionally poor , 7 euros per day for WIFI, surprising considering the high room rates and you are charged extra for an early morning departure - incredible ! Hotel needs to improve it's customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Super central location”
Reviews.Author: ktomom
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice. The location is superb for walking around Rome. Staff tried to be helpful but seem a bit snotty to be honest. They try is all I can say. The breakfast is very nice, especially if you can eat outside during the nicer times of the year. Rooms are nice size for sure. The rooms seemed to be kept moderately clean to clean. I felt a little more cleaning chould have been done. Overall a nice place to stay. On the pricey side even for Rome........ but location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic , will be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Gillian C
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights with two other girls for a quick trip to Rome. The room was plenty big for the three of us and the bathroom was very modern and spotless, the water in the shower was nice and hot. The breakfast served on the roof top was great a large selection and no long lines as often experienced ij hotels where breakfast is included in the price of the room. Beautiful roof top area is not used at other times so it is no problem sitting up therein the evenings with a bottle of wine, The staff were very nice, the bar man full of suggestions for dinners and generally very nice without being overbaring. We needed to print an email confirmation for tickets to the vatican museums and the front desk did everything they could to help us and printned the email. 7euro for wifi for a 24hour period, worked well. Constant security presence due to locatioj but this did notput us off, will be returning to this hotel for sure walking distance to all the hotels shops and resturants , i wouldn't consider staying anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Paula B
Reviews.Content: Room was on the top floor, so no views from the small window but otherwise room was excellent. Clean and tidy and well priced for the excellent location. Breakfast served on the roof with awsome views over Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Wonderful Roof Garden, good price”
Reviews.Author: MGIUS
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, in the hearth of the city, facing of the Parliament House (this would trigger some trouble in case of political events challenging the government because sometime police closed the place and in the keenest one the action beetwen demonstratord and police would be dangerous). My rooms was quite large, clean, quite and confortable. Most of them has very good view on the place. The breakfast is not very rich, but is served in the very Wonderful roofgarden that offers one of the most beatiful view on the hold town that one could have in Rome. The service is ok. Value for money is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: bnklwyr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of the Pantheon District, in easy walking distance to several historical and tourist locations. The Parliament building is right across the plaza, the Pantheon, within two blocks, the Pizza Navona, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps (and shopping) all within a 10 minute walk and the Roman Forum and Colosseum within a 20 minute or so walk. Also there are numerous great restaurants nearby. The Vatican was a reasonable cab ride away. The service at the hotel was impeccable, from the communications on questions we had about transportation and other things before we arrived to the service while we were there. The included breakfast was quite enjoyable. While the accommodations themselves are not luxurious, and the hotel does not offer some accoutrements that the true luxury hotels do, they were definitely comfortable. Since we wanted to spend much more time seeing Rome than spending time at the hotel, luxury was not necessary for us. We recommend this hotel highly for those who are in Rome to see the sights and who want their hotel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lamphere40
Reviews.Content: This hotel offwered typical Ruropeon luxury. It is a small hotel but the beauty of it along with the staff will make you want to go back. We are.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: laurieandjoe
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in our 10 day trip to Italy. Wonderful location, great size room, beautiful rooftop spot for breakfast or relaxing. Helpful staff, clean accoomodations, Good breakfast with great food. We walked everywhere. Never had to take metro. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: bobsx3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonna Palace for 4 nights. The best thing about the hotel is it's location - a close walk to many of Rome's wonderful attractions. Aside from that we found our stay to be of average quality: our room was comfortable and relatively clean but tired and in need of a refresh; most of the staff we encountered were helpful and friendly though we had a couple of experiences with one particular front desk person who was extremely rude. One other thing..... there were political protests going on around the hotel (as it is located opposite parliament house) so access to the hotel was restricted at times via certain entry points and the police were camped out by our window so we couldn't sleep with the window open. Obviously these issues were no fault of the hotel, but still something to bear in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: emm511
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on our two week honeymoon in italy. When booking we upgraded the room and glad we did, the room was plenty spacious. Front desk and all staff were very friendly and helpful-- restaurant reservations and museum reservations. Breakfast was really good and plentiful selection. The roof terrace was beautiful, great view of Rome. The hotel was steps from the Pantheon. We actually walked to all major sites- never getting on the subway, vatican was about 30 min walk and colusseum a 20min walk, trevi about 10min and spanish steps about 15. We thought it was the best way to see the whole city. Highly recommend getting gelato at GIOLITTI- best we had in italy.

Reviews.Title: “the best location you could ask for”
Reviews.Author: rona_z
Reviews.Content: we stay at the colona palace every year and will keep doing so. its major advantages are, first and foremost, the excellent location as well as the beautiful rooftop terrace where breakfast is served. there's also a nice little lounge area on the roof with a Jacuzzi. what i like best is that the rooftop terrace stays open all the time and we love going up there with drinks and food to watch the sunset with its beautiful colors over rome. this was the first time we asked to change rooms just because we got a room that was quite small so we were moved to room 138 which was large and very beautiful. it isn't facing piazza but the street behind the hotel, but that was no problem at all, especially for us since we're regulars there. the only thing i thought was missing in the room is a full length mirror. i especially want to point out the excellent service from all the staff. a special Grazie Mille to Francesco from Noa and Rona Zelivansky from Tel-Aviv. see you next year! :)

Reviews.Title: “We love it!”
Reviews.Author: CATraveler85
Reviews.Content: At the end of our Mediterranean cruise, our group of 7 adults and 2 children decided to stay in Rome for 4 nights. After reading about several hotels in Rome and all the reviews about Colonna Palace Hotel, we chose this one for its location, and absolutely did not regret it! We booked 4 rooms, three doubles and one triple. The rooms were clean and of decent size. The beds were firm and comfortable and relatively large in size compared to the average European hotel bed; I just wished I brought my own pillow; the hotel's were quite thin! The remodeled bathrooms were clean and the shower was excellent - the water felt like a pwerful cascade on your body! What surprised me and impressed me the most is the fact that they changed the bed sheets daily! All the reviews on this hotel mentioned about the beautiful view from the breakfast terrace - and it is absolutely true! The view is amazing and the quality of the continental breakfast is pretty good. They provide regular coffee, but if you would like a more gourmet one, like a capuccino, all you need to do is ask for it. :-) This hotel is centrally located, and we easily walked to the Spanish steps (10 minutes), Trevi Fountain (4 minutes), Navona Plaza (10 min.) and Colosseum (20 min. max). Less than 2 short blocks away, there are many restaurants and outdoor cafes to choose from. We tried a different one every day. The one restaurant I do NOT recommend is Antica Trattoia da Pietro al Pantheon dal 1842. They charged us 13.50 euro for bread and olive oil/vinegar (1.50 euro per person)! I know bread is not free like in the USA; to charge per basket is undertandable, but, to charge per person is what I found to be outrageous! They gave us only 2 small baskets and not all bread was consumed. I didn't make a big stink at the restaurant but wanted to make sure to mention about this in this review to warn potential "victims." Regarding maps, there's no need to purchase one before going to Rome. The hotel can give you a complimentary one which is very detailed. Would I stay in this hotel again? Yes! You can't beat its central location; the service is good; and the price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Susi14
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the Colonna Palace from June 30 - July 4, 2011 for the first leg of my Italy honeymoon. You can't beat this location. It's central to all the major attractions and we did not have to take a taxi not once. The Vatican and the Colosseum were the farthest away but even then we were able to walk to them in about 30 minutes which is not bad at all. The hotel itself is not the most modern hotel and the rooms are a bit run down and small but again, you can't beat the location. The bathrooms were very clean and you can tell that they had been updated recently so we were happy with that. Staff is friendly and the continental breakfast offered at the rooftop terrace is decent. I would recommend this hotel to a friend in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “spacious rooms, beautiful rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: trishgio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were extremely happy with our choice of hotel. Located next to the parlement so there were lots of police around giving us a sense of security. Very close to a lot of Rome's attractions. The Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, so many places just a short walk away. Our room was quite a surprise with its spacious living room, separate bedroom and bathroom containing a bathtub and shower. We were disappointed with the Internet connection in our room though and I actually had to go to the staircase to get a signal. The view from the rooftop terrace is stunning. We loved having our breakfast there in the morning and were quite happy with the choices in the buffet. The staff were helpful but made no lasting impressions. We would certainly recommend this hotel though and would consider returning there.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: smm2518
Reviews.Content: Rome is a beautiful city all around. The Colonna Palace was a wonderful hotel. The room is nice and very clean. The staff is friendly and very helpful. It is in a very ideal location. The hotel is only about 2 min from the Trevi fountain. We ate outside of the Pantheon several times. It is a very close walk and is beautiful at night. You can get everywhere from here. Bus stops are close as well as restaurants, and shops. I would highly recommend this hotel. Breakfast was very good. The variety of food is not as large as some of the other hotels we stayed at in Italy, however they are very accommodating. The one morning there were no more eggs and they very nicely asked if we wanted some. They brought us our own plates of freshly made scrambled eggs. Was an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Position perfect for Rome in a day”
Reviews.Author: Kes58
Reviews.Content: We flew from Melbourne, Australia and arrived exhausted to stay at the Colonna Palace Hotel in Rome for two nights, for our first ever visit. Rome was our first stop on our 'eleven nights in Europe' tour. After our nights in Rome, we planned to go to Positano, Italy for four nights and then we were to fly to Barcelona for a conference for five nights. We always knew that we were going to be tired and time poor for our two nights in Rome. Following the Rome visit, we had booked a train to go to Naples and then a driver and a guide to visit Pompeii for three hours on our way to Positano (a great plan that was expensive but it worked exceptionally well). I had found it difficult to decide upon a hotel in Rome, as there were many to chose from. I consulted our cit holidays booklet from our Flight Centre travel agent in Melbourne and with that in hand, trawled the trip advisor reviews. In the end, we chose Hotel Colonna Palace and we loved the position and proximity to the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish steps, the restaurants, the Pantheon, and the hotel was just close enough to walk to the Colosseum too. It was also opposite the Lower House of the Italian Parliament, Palazzo Montecitorio. We had booked a Superior room, and our room that we were taken to was quite spacious, charming and lovely with its traditional Italian decor and high moulded ceilings. There was a lot of natural light in the room. The bathroom was large enough and it had a great design and fit out, and the entry into the room was separate which I liked. The only issue was getting used to the idea that the peaceful protesters would be camping outside all night below our hotel window. When we arrived mid afternoon, I tried closing the window properly to shut out some noise from the megaphone outside, but the window wouldn't shut properly (I have been since told that many a hotel windows often do not). I don't think that closing the window properly would have made much of a difference to the noise anyway. As I was feeling tired and irrational, I asked for a room change. The staff were very helpful and showed us to a similar room above it that would take an hour to clean. My husband insisted that we stay in our original room, until he discovered that the safe wouldn't work. We thought that in Rome, this was essential, so then we both agreed to change rooms. By this time, we went to the second room, where I found that the bed made an awful noise even when you sat on it, so after much time wasting and heated emotions, we made a plea to the hotel staff to return to our original room, as another staff member had by then volunteered to us that they could replace the battery in the safe in our original room so that it would probably work! With the safe working, and the window not quite shutting properly, we were happy and settled in our original room. We had exhaustion, jet lag, and ear plugs, but we knew we would be comfortable and sleep for the night. We were ready to explore Rome! Following our room change incident, the staff at reception remained friendly and extremely helpful with maps and a restaurant recommendation. They bore no grudges against us! We were back on track, just a little bit later in the day that we wanted to be. That same afternoon, we managed to do lots of walking to the Colosseum via the Trevi Fountain. Prior to our departure I had booked a tour of the Colosseum (no monies paid at this stage), but as we were late, we missed this but we did manage to skip the queue and we did an audio guided tour for a short while. We ate later and returned to the hotel to sleep, and we slept right through the night, the noise outside our room was not an issue. The rooftop breakfast was one of the highlights in this hotel, and the setting was perfect. During our breakfast, we learned from a couple of young American ladies staying in the hotel that one of their wallets had been stolen out of their handbag the day before whilst in a restaurant (not the hotel's restaurant). It was stolen by a group of well dressed, probably professional thieves sitting on a table, for a short amount of time, behind them. By the time the ladies had managed to alert the bank, about $3,000 worth of goods had already been purchased! The message to us there was to take a bag that could be easily sat on the lap throughout meal service. The food on offer at the rooftop breakfast was mostly good, except it was lacking in that there was no fresh fruit platter, and that the hot water for teas and coffee were never quite, really hot. Other than that, there was plenty of other selection and we were happy. Our second night in the hotel was spent with a different group of protesters outside our window. They were a quieter group than the night before and surprisingly again, they didn't bother us either! What did bother us was another guest banging so loudly on the door of the room next door, that we woke up with such a fright I thought there was a fire in the hotel. Having that happen was annoying, but that could happen in any hotel around the world. In summary, our stay at the Colonna Palace Hotel in Rome was fun (although sometimes it didn't feel exactly like that because we were tired) and quirky in some parts, but that added to the overall experience. I would recommend the hotel because of its central location and its roof top breakfast dining room, and in particular because the staff were very patient with us when we were weary travellers and we had our room change issue. They really tried hard to help and they didn't give up on us, and when you are travelling that is the attitude you want and you very much appreciate it when it is given.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location”
Reviews.Author: RWaters333
Reviews.Content: Last visit to Rome, we stayed near the Railway station, too far from everything except Tour buses. The Colonna Palace was recommended to us by two seperate friends. They were so right! Walk out the front door to Parliament House Square. Parliament was sitting so lots of action going on. Three minutes stroll to Trevi Fountain and a little further on, the Spanish Steps. In the opposite direction, three minutes to the Pantheon, 10 more minutes to Piazza Navona and another 20 minutes to the Vatican. So central, and only a 12 Euro taxi trip from the Railway station. The rooftop Breakfast Room is superb. Fabulous view while you are eating. The female staff were brilliant, the male staff quite helpful. A little noisy at night as the air conditioning wasn't working and we had to have our windows open. Ear plugs helped. Would not ever stay anywhere else while visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location + American Style Bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: deetzter
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Colona Palace Hotel. Depending on the time of year, it can be a bit pricey but well worth it if you are of the - you get what you pay for mind set. The location can't be beat. Very close to the Pantheon, and a couple of blocks from Spanish Steps. Hotel staff is great. The rooms are nicer than the typical European rooms. The bathrooms seem to be recently remodled and were as close to an American bathroom as I've seen in Europe. Full bath/shower, etc. This was stay number three, and I am sure there will be a fourth. I have recommended this hotel to many others. During the peak season, it was cost prohibitive for some. In the off season (when I go) it was comparable to other similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: ADT2008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Colonna Palace Hotel for four nights in mid October 2010 with a girl friend. This was our last hotel on a 3 week trip to Italy. The location of the hotel cannot be beat, just a couple blocks from the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, Piazza Navona and within walking distance to the Spanish Steps, the Vatican and the Colosseum. Our room on the 4th floor was a decent size with nice furnishings, modern bathroom of good size, a fridge in the room. It was a little warm and it was heat season, not AC, so they brought us a fan and we opened the window for some fresh air. We were on the alley side of the building, so we did hear some street noise with the window open, but hey, we were in the middle of Rome and knew what to expect. We were so tired at the end of the day, we fell right asleep. One of the best features of the hotel is the roof top terrace where breakfast is served. We loved being there, and went up in the evenings to drink a bottle of wine as the sun set. A very lovely way to end a day! Breakfast was good, with a good selection of meats, cheese, breads, cakes, cereal, fruit and even scrambled eggs. Great coffee and good service too. The weekday front desk guy and bell men were great and very helpful. The weekend front desk guy was not as fluent in English, and less helpuful. Overall it was a wonderful stay in a good hotel in a great location. A little pricey, but it is Rome afterall (like staying in Times Square, NY)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but bit old fashioned and dowdy”
Reviews.Author: BristolBarry22 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: If you want a cetnrally based location so you can walk to all the major attractions and areas in Rome, this takes some beating. It is slightly disconcerting to have to run the gauntlet of police and secret service armed officers whenever the parliament is sitting to get into and out of the hotel but it's quite fun. The hotel itself is a bit dowdy and old fashioned but clean and the staff are polite. The roof terrace is lovely - fabulous views over the rooftops of the city with a small jacuzzi and comfy seating. The bedrooms and bathrooms are adequate but a good size. The breakfasts need improvement. Very boring with mostly bread and no real fresh fruit or cooked dishes

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel at a perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Paula48_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights. It was excellent! The staff was very friendly, they speak english very well, and helpfull. The room was good, spacious and clean. Towels were replaces every day and even the sheets were changed daily! Breakfast was good and is served on the roofterras. Superb!! The view over Rome is fantastic. The location off this hotel is perfect: next to the Italian Parlement (so there's police every day and when you're lucky a demonstration (we were)!! It is a three minute walk to the Pantheon, Trevi is about 8 minutes, Vatican, Villa Borghese, Colosseum: we walked everywhere. So this is the perfect place to be!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dave4523
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Colonna Palace for 5 nights, our room faced the square. We arrived early and were given our room right away which we were very grateful for after a very long flight. Our room was very clean, although the furnishing was not brand new it was very nice, remember you are staying in the center of an ancient city. The location was perfect for us as we were able to walk to every major site, we do enjoy walking to see the city not just the tourist sites. Having said that, there is plenty of public transportation if you prefer. Breakfast was great, more than enough options to please most tastes, and a wonderful view of the city from the rooftop garden. I e-mailed in advance of our arrival to arrange transportation from the airport and was helped by a lovely young woman, Sara Pedone, we had the pleasure of meeting her on our second day there. She was a pleasure, very friendly, polite and extremely helpful, thank you Sara for everything. As to the no restaurants nearby we had no trouble finding many wonderful places to eat, most do open late, so you may have to adjust your eating habits. One bit of advice most streets do not go straight through, lots of turns, so bring a compass and a good map, our GPS did not work well on the narrow roads. Do not start a diet, the food, the pastries and the gelato are not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: doccop18
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was excellent - right across the plaza from the Parliament building and walking distance to all of the ancient attractions of Rome as well as great restaurants and shopping nearby. The rooms were mediocre - small and dated. The bed was very uncomfortable and the mattress old, which made sleeping difficult (and I can usually sleep anywhere). WiFi was expensive (around $10/day). Breakfast was a highlight, though, with wonderful food served buffet style on the rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Newaygo
Reviews.Content: I was happy I selected this hotel. I arrived in Rome at 9 am. I had thought that I would have to check my bags and check-in around 2 pm, but since they had a room available, they were able to check me in right away at no extra cost. The shower was appreciated. The first room was quite warm and to cool it off we needed to crack the window open at night. Unfortunatly, the room was on the 'backside' of the hotel and the delivery noises and traffic in the alley during the early morning hours were horriffic and kept me up. I still haven't been able to figure out where they were delivering. You should definetely request a room facing the square. It was much quieter. When I explained the problem, they were able to accomodate me. Note that the rooms facing the square are smaller on the square side, so if you have more than 2 in a room, you will be crowded. The service by the front desk was excellent, the breakfasts were all you can eat and included meat, cheese and eggs along with the normal breakfast fare. We were there during a February cold snap so did not eat on the rooftop, but we did visit there and take photographs. It would have been lovely had it been warmer. The location is ideal. We were able to walk to all the major destinations including the Vatican. The Trevi fountain and Parthenon were 5 minutes away by foot. The only bus we took was to the Roman Forum and Colisseum. A major bus terminal was located about 2 blocks away. Make sure you ask for directions to the 'Gilloteri'. Very close to the hotel and some of the best ice cream I ever had. My wife was put off by the police presence in the square, but I looked at that as a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal - particularly out of season”
Reviews.Author: spadesaspade
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many many times, over the last 10 years, and it is always a pleasure to be welcomed back. Pleasant, helpful staff, perfectly acceptable rooms some recently renovated, one of the best central locations near the 'old' city, well connected and with that iconic roof terrace. if it has a drawback, it is its proximity to the parliament building but security couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, central, homey”
Reviews.Author: jiminvirginia1
Reviews.Content: We are upper middle class American professionals of retirement age who stayed here by chance 10 years ago and have returned twice since. Can't beat the access to central Rome, but you want to walk a bit to get away from the tourists. Friendly staff, in addition to thw roof garden breakfast, there is a nice Italian bar for mid-morning coffee or night cap. I'd not advise it for the young set or for the flashy. Thankfully, it would be boring for them.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chris1052
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful. Clean, spacious rooms, extremely handy to everything. The staff were wonderful & helpful from the front desk to the lovely man in the Bar. Homely. The quaint lift was a highlight & the rooftop terrace was SUPERB not only for the view (which was unsurpassed) but the wonderful breakfasts served there. We had many a late night nightcap there just gazing over Rome! Atmosphere plus. We certainly will be back.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: bettyruble
Reviews.Content: Visited the hotel with friends for a nice weekend, room was gorgeous and comfortable with a lovely view of the government building. Staff were friendly and helpful, And breakfast on the rooftop , we were all pleasantly surprised, was just perfect. Every morning we could admire the views over the city and take in the day ahead of us. It was breathtaking. The continental breakfast had a fantastic choice of fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, hot food enough to set you up for a great tour around the city. The Pantheon just a short walk from the hotel and lovely eating places. Visit the Trevi fountain, spanish steps and shops. The Vatican was superb, amazing and so much to describe and explain. For the time of year it was lovely to see the Crib and lights of the Christmas trees. Wine and food delicious, and found a friendly irish bar which let us relax into the early morning. Be practical about what you wear on your feet, lots of cobble streets so heels girls not particularly good idea for out and about. Pack comfy shoes, warm light weight clothes and layer up, gloves and scarfs and a small umberella. Hotel has lovely shampoo, shower gel and soap bars so no need to pack too much tolietries. Most of all don't forget the camera, with a large memory card you will need it. Watch out for pick pcokets and seperate your money in various pockets. ASk hotel staff for guide maps and reputable taxi companies. The colloseum is a must and with a tour much more interesting than going it alone, also prepare around 3 hrs to enjoy it. Expect the unexpected here, and hope u enjoy. I'm on my way back to this hotel very soon. Have made several recommendations to this hotel since my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Rome - Breakfast on the rooftop terrace with unbeatable views”
Reviews.Author: simwhere
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its location on the square facing the Italian Parliament buildings, because it's at the epicenter of all the most important sights in Rome. There is no need to take taxis - simply grab a map from the reception counter and walk out of the door into Rome. The Pantheon is around the corner, Trevi Fountain is 2 streets away, the Colosseum down the road behind one of the most beautiful palaces in Rome. Shopping and the Spanish steps are 10 minutes walk up the road. Piazza Navona is so close that we wandered around there every day of our stay. The hotel is warm and welcoming with a lovely lobby area, nice to enjoy a late night drink. Our room was on the 4th floor, but not a problem, because there are 2 elevators. I asked for a front room with a view of the parliament buildings (we were given a side room, but still with a good view). I was hoping to see some political action from my window. The most I saw was TV crews waiting in the square - apparently also hoping for some action. Our room was adequate, with a big double bed, lovely crisp white sheets, big flat pillows (which were not so comfortable), we managed to sleep very well. There was a flat screen TV, but we could not find a single channel in English. There is a minibar, also the usual toiletries (shampoo, etc) in the bathroom. The cherry on the top is the breakfast room on the top floor which opens onto a terrace with a wooden deck and small pool, filled with potted plants and flowers, and an exclusive view of Rome. What a gorgeous way to start the day...Hot tea/coffee and croissants, muesli, fruit and yogurt...and the quiet morning views before Rome comes alive.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Central, Quiet with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: bill437
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights prior to a tour, our first trip to Italy, not sure what we were expecting but were pleasantly surprised by this hotel, we only ate breakfast there, wasn't flash but more than adequate. Room was on the first floor, at the end of a long corridor, it was large and a bit dark, with a small balcony/landing overlooking a lane, bathroom appeared to have been recently upgraded and was bright and modern. Staff were pleasant and helpful and provided a map on registration marked the hotel on the map and explained tourist attractions close to the hotel i.e. Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Vatican, restaurant areas and also marked them on the map. Only disappointment was that wi-fi wasn't free but it really didn't impact on us very much as I had my Blackberry and could receive emails etc. We would certainly consider staying there again if a room was available to suit or itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “great location close to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: Brett62_10
Reviews.Content: situated opposite parliment building lots of police and security 24/7 which gave assurance of safety.short walk to trevi fountain and restaurants was very good. we coulld walk to most attractions with map once you got your bearings.we walked to and from vatican city 1-2 ks and back a different way and covered other famous sites.would stay at same hotel on next visit.if using trains etc dont forget to validate tickets!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful terasse for breakfast, super location”
Reviews.Author: Miniline
Reviews.Content: Very good location and near to many restaurants at night, and quite nighttime.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but crazy front desk clerk”
Reviews.Author: travellergirl1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and it's also a pretty decent hotel. I travelled with on my own, with my two children aged 12 and 13. My son went to the front desk and asked the man on the front desk if he could do something about the air conditioning in the bedroom, which was very noisy. The clerk was very rude to my son. When I asked him not to speak to him in that manner, he went ballistic, raved and shouted for about five minutes. The next minute he saw me and had another go! The other staff were fine, but this guy is a lunatic. I actually didn't get a word in edgeways. Very unstable sort of guy. But I'd stay in the hotel again, it was fine although like many hotels in Europe, very expensive for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Location was fabulous - decent 4 star hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: NDPri
Reviews.Content: The location was its USP...5 minutes to Trevi/Nuvano fountains and 10-15 minutes walk to Colosseum and vatican city...great great location...room was small for the price we paid but then Rome hotels are expensive...the service was okay...i liked the roman style window very nice...otherwise best for travellers not looking to explore Rome on foot...bed was double bed so had the best sleep in Italy as all other hotels even 5 star have only twin beds...

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: fufty
Reviews.Content: Rome is not a cheap place - either to stay in or to eat in, but it is well worth the money! This was our second visit but this time our 18 yr. old son was coming too which complicated the search for a hotel, as we needed a triple room. Many hotels claim triple rooms but they turn out to be tiny twins with an extra bed pushed in. We were recommended Colonna and trawled the sites for the best deal. Like most Rome hotels it looks old and delapidated from the outside and is traditional inside. Francesco on the front desk was welcoming and extremely helpful, as was the case with most of the staff. Our room on the 2nd floor was lovely - plenty of storage space in a hallway, a huge bed plus an extra for our son. We had 3 floorlength windows, one of which opened right onto Parliament Square and two on a side street, and THIS is the real benefit ot the hotel - bang in the middle of one of the world's loveliest cities. Breakfast on the terrace was delighful even though it was the usual Italian version. One day we bought lunch from Spar ( just a couple of streets away at The Pantheon ) and ate it up here. As the rooftop is only used for breakfast the staff have no problem with this. We also went up at night with a bottle of wine and watched Rome go to bed. On the terrace there is a little plunge pool but it gets terribly dirty from all the birds who drop feathers and bread. The maids kept the room well with fresh linens, towels and toiletries. All in all a delightful stay which we all loved.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: linnymc3
Reviews.Content: We e really enjoyed our stay in Rome. This hotel was in a GREAT LOCATION and the staff was responsive to our needs. Airconditioning was 'fair'.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel with view of Rome in the city center + whirlpool”
Reviews.Author: ansjohnson7
Reviews.Content: This is wonderful hotel located directly in the heart of Rome. All of the important tourist sites are within walking distance. This includes Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Pantheon. The best thing about this hotel was the roof top terrace with a whirlpool. Every morning the breakfast was served here. The view was breathtaking. You have wonderful view of Rome over the rooftops of all of the buildings. After sight-seeing during in the morning, it was wonderful to simply cool off in the whirlpool. After the first two nights I found that the best place for dinner was this rooftop terrace. Get a pizza or pasta from a restaurant, buy a bottle of wine a supermarket and then you have all of the ingredients for a romantic sunset dinner. The sun set right next to St. Peter’s Cathedral. The rooms itself were a bit mixed bag. The bathrooms had been recently remodeled, but the rooms itself need to be updated. Some of the rooms are terribly small. I think the rooms in the back of the building have more space. I was first in a corner with a nice view of Piazza Montecitorio, but there was little space to walk around the bed. The second room we stayed was very spacious. Now my hotel experience would have been wonderful except for one problem. The air conditioning did not function correctly in my room. It was stuck at the lowest setting. This is a problem when the temperatures are above 30°C. Normally I would not be too mad, but the management had already known about the problem with the room and did not bother to put us in another room to begin with. Now I would recommend staying in this hotel if one the air conditioning works properly and you get a more spacious room in the back of the building. The rooftop terrace and the location is the main selling point for this hotel. You could probably stay at another hotel for a lower price, but not with such a view

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff helpful, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lablover99
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel there was alot of police due to the fact that the hotel is located next to the Parliment building. It was early morning and they were preparing for a protest. Our rooms were not ready but we were able to use the restroom and change from our long flight. They gave us a map and pointed out several points of interest. We ventured out and over the next 4 days found that we were able to walk to the Trevi Fountain, The Pantheon, Spanish Steps, The Vatican, The Colosseum and all the places in between. The hotel is centrally located to everything. Our rooms were clean and the rooftop terrace is wonderful for breakfast. One negative was the seagulls outside our window. Don't know if it was due to the courtyard echo or if it was just that they breed large and loud in Italy but in the early morning they sound like dinosours. Very loud. Overall we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we have found in Rome”
Reviews.Author: djhallett
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Rome 4 times over the years and this is the best. Why.... because Great location. In the same square as the Italian parliament. walking distance to most of the great sights,Trevi,Spanish Steps,Piazza Navone,shopping,Old Rome. Hotel amenities are very well maintained. Staff. Ok Breakfast served on the roof....great view ok food Restaurant recommendations from staff...spot on!

Reviews.Title: “we love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rona_z
Reviews.Content: we are sworn lovers and Italy - we come every year and always stay at the Colona Palace. you couldn't possibly ask for a better location, which is the most significant thing there is to say about this hotel, but other than that the staff is very nice, breakfast on the terrace is a real treat, plus there's a little cool tub on the terrace where you can soak to cool down... we especialy like going up there at night with a pizza and a bottle of wine - the view is amazing :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, panorama roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Pond
Reviews.Content: Good buffet breakfast in a panorama roof terrace, friendly staff (at least, if you speak some Italian). Bring your own bottle to the roof top terrace in the evening and watch how la bella Roma settles to the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very well situated but beware of the inaccurate website and some reviews.”
Reviews.Author: VivienShropshireUK
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel which was well situated for the sites. The rooms are spacious and well serviced- clean sheets and towels every day etc., although we did have to keep asking repeatedly when we wanted extra blanketsand pillows. I had checked their website and Tripadvisor and other reviews before we travelled but found some of them prety inaccurate. There are defintely no tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms- I pointed this out to reception and they said that they are aware that the website is not accurate but that this is the fault of the agency which designed it! There are also no "kitchenettes", no bathrobesetc.( not that we were bothered by that) but the rooms do have air-con and hairdriers. Good breakfasts up on the roof terrace,though. Not cheap, though -the rate on the door for a twin room was 430 euros a night. We had to move (caught up in the volcano/flight cancellations saga) and went to theHotel Louis nr Ciampino Airport where staff are really helpful and a nice twin room cost 75 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: Lazarustic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for seeing Rome on foot and is surrounded by some of the best restaurants in Rome (notably the Bottega - just around the corner from the hotel). The roof terrace for breakfast is a must - with views of all Rome first thing in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Location and style”
Reviews.Author: hudsonhmeyer
Reviews.Content: The Colonna Palace Hotel provided us with a wonderful base for our time in Rome. Location cannot be faulted - almost everything is within walking distance and this was a major "plus" for us. It was great to be able to walk to attractions easily as a group, but I was also able to take solo walks around the Pantheon and local district when there was a spare half hour in the afternoons. Make sure you bring a good street/walking map. We arrived in Rome mid morning, and it was great that we were able to check into our room quite early and refresh after a long flight. Staff were generally helpful although at times seemed a little aloof. Rooms were very comfortable and it was lovely to be able to watch Rome "go about its business". During our stay there were a few public protests in the areas outside our windows (given so near to Parliament) but this just added to the local experience! Fantastic breakfast terrace with beautiful views of the city. We stayed in winter, so too cold to eat on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff, amazing rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: canfindaname
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in late November in a triple room (255). It was my 7th trip to Rome, and second stay at the Colonna Palace. We were thrilled that the rooftop terrace was still being used for breakfast, even in late November, and each evening we brought our own wine up and watched sunsets and bird waltzes over the city. The staff recommended some great restaurants nearby (there are soooo many to choose from), opened our wine for us, and arranged our transportation to the airport. I've stayed at other hotels in Rome (near Termini/Colosseo), but this location is really ideal and worth a little extra money. Thank you CP for hosting my 50th!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: groggy73
Reviews.Content: The location is a 2 min walk from Pantheon, 4 min from Piazza Navona, 4 min from piazza di campo dei fiori, 5 min from Trevi fountain, 5 min from spanish steps. So you can reach everything by foot, easily. Maybe get on a bus for Vatican state, but not neccessary. The breakfast at hotel was ok, at least real scrambled eggs, and good coffee. Make sure you sit at the roof terrace while having breakfast, to get a view of Rome. The location is actually very quiet, even with the location, because the hotel is facing the piazza in front of parlament building, with no traffic, and a lot of guards and police. The only thing is that the hotel is a bit expensive, but if you get a good deal, the hotel can be recommended for a romantic holiday in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great Staff. Noisy Room.”
Reviews.Author: cmssmith00
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to the Colonna Palace by our travel agent and though it was in a great location I am not sure that I would recommend it to someone else. We had a tough time finding the hotel after taking a bus from the train station (much cheaper than a taxi, 2 euros vs. 50 euros!) since the hotel is facing a square and that square is set behind another... we passed it twice before finding it by chance. Once inside the front desk staff and others were super helpful to get our luggage up to the room and make sure we had a ride to a tour we'd set up. Breakfast was nice and the view from the rooftop terrace was beautiful! Our room was small, but fine for just being there to sleep. The bathroom was small as well but modern and clean. The beds were hard but not totally uncomfortable, the difficult part about the room was the noise level. Our room was on the 4th floor and faced the "alley" behind the hotel (not facing the square). We happened to be there the day their linens were delivered, and let's just say that a metal cart on cobblestone streets at 5am is not what you want to wake up to. I would recommend this hotel to others with the caveat that their room is on the square side, I can only hope that it would be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel..Right where you want to be!”
Reviews.Author: bainso
Reviews.Content: Our friend recommended this hotel to us & we are glad he did. It is in the square with the Parliament & Government Building. Lots of security there so felt very safe. We got a large room (larger than most European rooms) with a view of the square & the buildings mentioned above. There was a large bed...really 2 beds pushed together with a round glass-topped table on each side. There were 2 barrel-type chairs, a desk & chair, TV & a mini bar (the prices of beer & wine (3.50 E ea) were pretty reasonable)...there were several small drawers for our clothes. The AC worked fine. As you entered the room there was a large wooden Armoire for our hanging clothes, an in-room safe & 2 pairs of slippers. The bathroom was a good size & the towels nice & thick. They provide small bars of soap, shampoo, bath gel, shower caps, shoe sponge, a sewing kit, a hair dryer & plenty of hot water. The common areas of the hotel are furnished with period pieces & there is a small bar & sitting areas. The highlight of this hotel is the Roof Garden with a whirlpool & a fantastic view of the city. That is where we had the included buffet breakfast. As soon as we sat down we were approached & asked what we wanted....coffee, tea, hot chocolate or cappuccino. On the floor below there were more tables & the food & juices...scrambled & hard boiled eggs, various cold cuts...ham, salami, turkey, cheese & hard rolls. There were also pastry, cake slices & fruit. More was available too. This hotel is a short walk from the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, The Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Via Condotti with its many beautiful shops & Via Veneto. We walked everywhere from this hotel. Villa Borghese & gardens, Vatican City, Castel Sant'Angelo, Vittorio Emmanuel Monument, the Jewish Ghetto & many beautiful Squares & churches. There are many restaurants & places to just have a drink, people watch & to listen to the various street entertainers. The downside: The beds were hard, the pillows flat & there was only a bottom sheet & top sheet...no blanket...we had to use the bed spread when we got cold. The price for American's is high because of the exchange rate...not the hotel's fault! If you want to go to the Sistine Chapel or Galleria Borghese I strongly recommend you order your tickets online well before your trip. There is a beautiful church near the hotel...Church of Sant'Ignazio Di Loyola in Piazza S. Ignazio. Also near the hotel is Osteria da Mario Restorante in Piazza Delle Coppelle. I am sure despite a few negatives that you will be satisfied with this beautiful hotel. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice European hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: goofball-nl
Reviews.Content: We had a very lovely room with a large window that opened onto the front of the Embassy - great for people watching too. Front desk personnel very friendly, one great bartender, one "ok" bartender. Walking distance to everything. All in all, a great stay. (take your own travel pillow)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for all attractions and excellent service from staff”
Reviews.Author: aerowoman
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at Colonna Palace and the first time for my partner. My 1st time was a trip with friends, the hotel is great regardless of the type of break you intend. We would all choose this hotel again and were delighted with the location which makes all attractions walkable from base. The staff were all very helpful and responses to requests were both prompt and appropriate. The room we had was small but this is expected and does not matter given the little time spent there and it was nice, clean and had air conditioning that worked well. The rooftop terrace has a great view of the city, is a lovely place for breakfast and nice to relax in after a hard days sightseeing before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “great location-facelift needed”
Reviews.Author: travellady1Florida
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. The location is wonderful- I am a senior and was able to walk EVERYWHERE, from the Ghetto, to the Vatican, to the colosseum-etc. Breakfast was delightful, rooftop view of the entire city. Hotel itself really needs brightening- furnishings need an update. My bathroom was good, shower, bath, and it was recently done ( I think), but the rest needed work. Walls dirty, furniture old, and I could hear everything in the hall and the other rooms. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location..Great service”
Reviews.Author: OJGuz2006
Reviews.Content: The Colonna Palace was one of the stops on my worldwind 30th birthday vacation. The location was awesome once my husband and I figured out where exactly we were. ( The Colonna is walking distance from the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain and many clothing stores for those who love to shop) The rooms were nice, the staff was friendly and the breakfast was good. I would definelty go back the Colonna Palace. Tips for first time travelers to the Colonna: 1. the beds are firm but they all are in Europe 2. they do not have wash cloths in the bathrooms pack some with you and 3. if you want WiFi I had to buy a card for like 7 euros and it was good for unlimited access for 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location...”
Reviews.Author: Roamn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonna Palace for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon through Europe. It took about 15-20 minutes to get to in a taxi from the train station, but that's because a lot of the roads in Rome are one way. The hotel is located on Piazza Monticitorio, which is a lovely big square (no traffic!!!). The foyer was quite nice and the bell boy was lovely and took our bags up to our room. We were on the 2nd floor with a view over the piazza. The curtains and carpet in the room were a little out dated, but the room was quite spacious and clean. There was a smoke detector on the ceiling above the bed that had a tiny light that flashed and we found this a little annoying when trying to go to sleep (it seemed to light the whole room!). I actually hadn't noticed until my husband pointed it out, but it really wasn't that bad. Breakfast was served on the roof, which had really beautiful views. The buffet was quite substantial, with cereals, croissants, fruit, eggs and bacon. The hotel was quite tall so it looked over the roofs of many of the other buildings. There is a large building opposite the hotel in the piazza that was manned by security 24 hours a day, so we felt safe wandering around late a night. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the Patheon, Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain. We walked to Vatican City in about 15 minutes (we walked quite quickly as we were running late for our tour). Everything was easily reached by walking. We had a "hop on hop off" tour booked, but we really only used this to take us to the Colosseum, which we probably could have walked to in about 20-30 minutes. There were some really nice restaurants near the Patheon that served delicious pizza and pasta and were really affordable. It's not the most stylish hotel, but it was clean and comfortable and the location is really fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Service Above and Beyond Expectation”
Reviews.Author: arf2115
Reviews.Content: Some of our employees checked into the hotel and realizing that they did not have the proper business cards, worked with the hotel staff to find a local printer and coordinate the efforts. Our cards were printed by the end of the day and the staff was more than courteous about our inconvenience by offering to pick up the cards for us! I am very happy about the service as a business client!

Reviews.Title: “great location, horrible beds”
Reviews.Author: riverparkgal
Reviews.Content: Bed: extremely hard with flat, hard pillows A/C: apparently Rome has an ordinance that prevents hotels from turning on the A/C except in the mid-summer months. With just one window there was no circulation and the room was stuffy and warm. They did provide a fan which helped. Noise: the piazza in front of the hotel is the location for rallies, protests and other large gatherings, so don't plan on sleeping in. And every door that closed sounded like it had been slammed shut - old wood doors with little (or no) sound proofing. Staff: front desk wasn't quite rude, but generally not helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Nonna Sicilia
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Colonna Palace. There was no air conditioning yet even though it was very warm during the day. Thank goodness it still cooled off during the evening. We were told it would be another 10 days before AC would be turned on. Piero was very helpful at the front desk. He was always willing to help us and always with a smile. We requested an extra towel from the maid and was told they did not have extra's. The breakfast was sufficient and eating out on the terrace was very nice. The hotel is in an excellent location for walking to some of the main attractions in Rome and that is why I chose it and why I would recommend it. Nonna Sicilia, USA (Judy Hottel)

Reviews.Title: “Mostly compliments, few complaints”
Reviews.Author: katiemarg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from 10 days in Rome, and we spent the majority of the time in the Colonna Palace Hotel. While not cheap, it offered the best bang for the buck as far as location and comfort went. Rome is exhausting, and I honestly looked forward to coming back to our little sanctuary every day. The staff spoke English well and were very helpful and polite. The room was quite large (especially by Italian standards) with a HUGE, deluxe bathroom. Everything appears to be newly renovated. It is within a 10 minute walk to a ton of sights: Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, etc. It is not close at all to a Metro, which is the one downside of the location, but you can pick up a bus within a short 5 min (or less) walk, which takes you to the metro in less than 10min. Our room came equipped with a safe. And last but not least, was the fabulous breakfast included in the room price that was served every morning on a beautiful rooftop terrace (they have an indoor eating spot as well). I have a few complaints, the largest being that the rooms have a lot of street noise. The majority of rooms overlook a busy cobblestone street where vehicles drive fast and people talk loudly, and it all echoes right up the wall. I had earplugs in while I slept and still heard the traffic quite clearly, so keeping the windows open at night was out of the question. If we had been on the other side of the hotel, though, there was construction noise (we never figured out from what) that woke my husband at 1:30am (?!). On top of all that, the walls are pretty thin, so you can definitely hear the neighbor's toilet flushing and TV quite clearly. My second complaint would be the comfort of the bed. It was overly firm, for my taste, and the pillows were so flat it was like sleeping with no pillow at all. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. It lives up to it's 3-star classification for the most part, and the pros far outweigh the cons.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: TheBusyMumAndDad
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights, at the end of a holiday in Italy, at Colonna Palace through Hotelclub.com and stayed at end of March 08. Having been to Rome before we knew the area we wanted and also knew how well placed Colonna Palace was. The room was bigger than expected as a lot of rooms in Rome can be small. It was very clean and had a lovely bathroom. and very comfortable bed too. We noticed in 07 a lot of work going on at this hotel but the scaffolding was all way. It is a hotel of Roman style, pillars and guilding etc. Breakfast was served on the roof garden and given the lovely weather on these days it was truely a lovely way to start the day. The staff were very efficient and friendly in every area of the hotel. Its location is a real bonus as it is so very close to all the tourist haunts. From the front of the hotel a right turn takes you in the direction of Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Via Del Corso (the main shopping street in Rome) a turn to the left at the hotel exit takes you to all the little streets and piazzas in the direction of the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. There will be no need for transport just a good comfy pair of walking shoes. We prefer the atmosphere at this area (Pantheon & Piazza Navona) at night to Trevi at night, where they hound you to buy the red rose (with the head sellotaped onto a stem!) but still! to see Trevi at night is beautiful and crowded so watch your belongings closely!!!! There will always be something new to see in Rome, one trip will never be enough - just keep throwing the coin the the Trevi and you will be sure to return:) It works for us! We would stay at this hotel again - its not 'Grand' but certainly comfortable, clean and very well located with no hassles and friendly helpful staff. No tea/coffee facilities in the room as is the norm in Rome and most of Europe but a travel kettle is easily carried!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: montana2006
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 1 night prior to a cruise of the Mediterranean. We had 2 rooms. When we arrived early, the gentleman at the desk suggested we wait for rooms facing the square and so, we left our bags and started exploring the city. The lobby was beautiful. It had a small bar that was great for coffees. The hotel faces a parliament building that has 24 hour police security, so we felt very safe. The rooms were small by US standards. Each room had 2 windows that opened to the square. The rooms were decorated in a very dark fabric but very clean. The room had an inroom safe. The bathrooms were all marble and very nice. The front desk was very helpful in advising were to eat, and calling taxis for us. The breakfast on the roof top deck was wonderful. It was a full breakfast of meats, cheeses, eggs and pastries. The location was very close to the Pantheon. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Working week in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: cbinlondon
Reviews.Content: I had to work for the week while in Rome. My travel agent got the booking wrong and only booked me a single room. But the hotel staff were excellent - very helpful, friendly and accommodating in sorting out a double room for me and my husband. Look...this fabulous little gem is in an outstanding location within walking distance of everything. Its neat and tidy, simple, and there is absolutely no better breakfast view in Rome!!! What better way to enjoy a coffee and pastry while overlooking an ancient obilesk in one direction; the President going to work in another; St Peter's Dome in another; and Capitoline Hill in another!!! All up - this fabulous little hotel is brilliantly placed for work or play and you can't go wrong. For history buffs, read the history of the Colonna family and it all makes this spot even more interesting. Thank you to all the staff of the Colonna Palace....your efforts are appreciated,

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit at a different time of year”
Reviews.Author: quasargal
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit at a different time of year Having spent several winter visits in Rome we decided on a last minute summer break for my birthday and decided to return to the Colonna Palace, mainly because of its location, which is central to everything. The breakfast on the roof terrace on a summer morning is magical, although the breakfast itself is very repetitive, there was plenty of it This time our adult daughter accompanied us complete with a broken arm in plaster. However the hotel arranged adjacent rooms and we were set fair for a good time. Then I noticed we had no drawer space, only hanging space in the wardrobe. As we were staying a week this seemed crazy. However a visit down to reception sorted it out and they moved is to a very nice room further down the corridor but still close to our daughter with lovely views towards the Italian Parliament Building. The rooms are kept spotless and they were both large with decent sized bathrooms and good working showers. The air-conditioning was worse than useless and could never get the room cooler than 29 degrees. We did complain and someone came and said it would be sorted but it never was. The furniture that some complained of being beat up have missed the point that it is supposed to look old and has been artificially ‘distressed’ The staff were friendly and helpful and one night when my husband and I went to a concert, the bar staff made sure my daughter was OK, chatting to her and making sure she was not hassled. The bar prices for cocktails (any spirit and mixer drink is called a cocktail in Rome) were cheaper than at the local restaurants. On my birthday a bottle of prosecco (Italian champagne) was on ice in our room courtesy of www.travelcounsellors.com our travel agent, and the hotel had put nibbles and nuts with it, so it was a lovely surprise after a hot day of sightseeing. Take a folding umbrella to Rome in August, not for the rain but to use as a sunshade especially for the open topped touring buses. A tip about Rome in August. On the 15th of August is a festival that dates from the time of Emperor Augustus called Ferragosto. This is a day when Romans leave the city and free concerts and events are held so that those who cannot leave have something to do. We went to a fantastic one on the Spanish steps complete with opera singers, dancers and firework. Take note - Between 7am and 9 am the city is deserted, so those of you who like me are keen photographers can fly round the city photographing all the sites without people on them. The streets and piazzas are empty. Even when the tourists wake up it is still a lot quieter at all the sites and queues are not much in evidence. The Vatican Museums are closed the 14th and 15th, but an early start meant we got in within 15 minutes of it opening the day afterwards. Do not miss the Doria Pamphilj Gallery, round the corner from the hotel which is the largest privately owned art collection in the city. Rome now charges to go into the Ancient Forum but the ticket includes the Coliseum and the Palatine Hill and if you are over 65 it is free. Get your tickets at the Forum gates not the Coliseum as the queues are long there and once you have got your ticket at the other places without queues, you walk pass the Coliseum queue with your head held high ! I would go again the the Hotel Colonna palace at the drop of a hat. I recommend the restaurant Zio Ciro opposite the Maddelena church just 5 mins from the hotel. They do wonderful pizzas, salads and grilled steaks and chops to die for and very reasonably. They have another branch opposite the Pantheon but it does not have the same menu, no grill! Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Hotel rooms need updating, overpriced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: Skithdeep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonna Palace for 3 night in July. The location is excellent- walking distance to most tourist sites. It's also very safe as it's patrolled around the clock being next to a government building. When we checked-in the gentlemen who helped us recommended a restaurant to us & we hadn't even asked him for a recommendation. He also made note to write his name on the card & told us to present it to the restaurant & we would receive a special discount or gift. I saw this same gentlement who checked us in the following evening & he asked me if we went to the restaurant he recommended & I told him that we went to another excellent restaurant that was recommended in my Rick Steve's book. You could tell he was little pissed off by that. I make a point of never going to restaurant recommendations when they write their name on the card because that usually indicates there is some kind of kick back involved to this person. Be wary of anyone that gives you a restaurant recommendation & then writes their name on the card & tells you to present this when you arrive. We had a triple room that was a decent size. We were located on the 6th floor. The A/C did not work in the hallway & barely worked in our room. I spoke to other people in the elevator & asked them how their A/C worked & they said barely. I also called the front desk to have them check it & they said it was at it's max. The also said the A/C in the hall was broken. When we were there the temps were in the 90's & humid and for as much as we were spending on this hotel you would have thought the A/C would work well. The furniture in our room was also well worn out & not what you would expect when you spend this kind of money. I've seen hotels in the states that were rated 2 stars that had much nicer room furniture then this place. I mean it looked really old & scratched up. They had a nice breakfast area on the top floor with an outside terrace overlooking the city. The breakfast was good with scrambled eggs, meats, cereals, pastries & juice- no complaints there. The best thing about this place is definitely it's location, but next time I would shop around & probably not stay here as I thought it was WAY overpriced for what you got. I also thought the front desk people had an attitude & were barely friendly. It's not what you expect when you spend this kind of money.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, perfect location, friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jenum24
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through a travel agent, but chose the hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor. My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights from 6/17 to 6/20 for our honeymoon as the beginning of our trip to Europe. It was our first time to Italy and we weren't too sure what to think of the hotel from the outside, but as soon as got to our room, we were SO happy! The room was much larger than we were expecting since rooms in Europe tend to run on the small side. We had a queen bed on the 3rd floor overlooking the square. The pillows are pretty flat, but that's pretty much the only thing I can find remotely bad. The room was very clean, we also had AC, which ran great, a decent sized bathroom, the location is minutes in walking distance to most major sites and we felt completely safe since there's a government building in the same square as the hotel and it's patrolled 24/7. The breakfast buffet is served on their roof terrace that overlooks the city - what a great start to a busy day! Breakfast includes scrambled and hard boiled eggs, croissants, rolls (not the sweet kind, more like dinner rolls), sliced peaches, yogurt, cereal and deli meats and cheeses. The only internet available is a station in the lobby and it's 5 euros for an hour, which is great, but it's also dial-up speed. There's a few internet cafes nearby that offer high speed for about 10 euros an hour if you need it. Also, I have to mention that the hotel staff (we encountered just about all of them throughout our stay) was very friendly and helpful - we had asked for restaurant recommendations, directions, postage and calling us a taxi. We will definitely stay here again upon our return to the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “We felt very safe here and it was central for walking Rome”
Reviews.Author: fionnuala1
Reviews.Content: Although I stayed here in May 2007, I am finally getting round to writing a review ( as I should for other places too since I find these reviews so helpful when I book!) Normally I am looking for child friendly locations but this trip was with two girl friends so it wasnt an issue. We had 2 nights, 3 days to "do" Rome so we wanted somewhere central and this was perfect. We walked the length and breadth of Rome in that weekend and this hotel seemed to be the centre of the city! We walked to the Colluseum and the Vatican with no stress at all and it is a hop and skip from the Trevi Fountain so we were able to "pop" there for last minute shopping on the last day. The Spanish steps are nearby too and shopping around the corner. The hotel itself is quite basic, even a little shabby in places but staff are friendly and rooms clean. We spent relatively little time in it, we didnt eat or drink there and cant comment on bar. It was a place to lie our heads after a day exploring the beautiful city and for that purpose alone, I would have to give it top marks. We felt very safe ( three women together) as I think there is some kind of police headquarters across the square from the hotel ( I could be corrected here) but day or night, it felt safe. I have sometimes gone up a star to "feel" safer when travelling with small children. I would stay here again, I would bring the children here as long as we didnt spend too long in the rooms....some are quite small. For an adult touring Rome.....it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Colonna RIP-OFF Palace”
Reviews.Author: fauxismeee
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed promising & I had researched it! I led a group of 20 ladies from Ca., to Florence, Tuscany & Rome, but this was a doozy... 1. I booked 10 double rooms, & upon arrival, was told that 4 would need to be singles as the hotel was booked. These were prepaid, & we were not reimbursed, "signora we can no do thees for you". Charm & politeness oozed. 2. Some of the rooms did not have safes, & some of the doors did not have proper working locks. Even after complaining, this was not taken care of. As a result, one gal was walked in on while in bed, so finally she was moved to another room. This was all too much for "Francesco", who so oozed charm earlier & now oozed false concern. I was stupid to have left some of my money in my room-in my bags in various spots, but when I returned, all of it was gone. My fault for leaving it there, but not so much as an appology or even an offer for a drink, coffe, nothing-but unbelievable rudeness! Francesco is oozing some sort of self-importance & disbelif. I had asked to speak with the manager many times in the corse of 3 days, to no avail. Fine. 3. The rooms were clean. Breakfast fair. 4. The front desk is without question the worst- they talk down to you in English & about you in Italian. I am Italian, & I was VERY ashamed. With so many choices in this lovely city, stay away from here.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: eleaviday
Reviews.Content: definitely great location and very safe as government building across the street....walk to THe Panthenon at night and have dinner in Piazza Navona Few blocks from the Trevi Fountain, also go at night as not as crowded....Hotel room was small but clean and the breakfast on the roof was nice....coleseum was the best also a great 10 minute walk LOcation but not overly touristy

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Colonna”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveRome
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Rome on Christmas Day was truely an experince! We had no problems at the airport, and had a driver, Leonardo pick us up at 8 AM and take us through Rome, on the way to the Colonna! When arriving to the Colonna you are taken through winding side streets - beautiful ! It is in a WONDERFUL area, across from the Parliament, so there was good security. There are many wonderful restraunts around the area, make sure you stay at the Colonna. Have Gelato!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ManorRoad
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an almost perfect location in Rome - we could walk to all the major sights, and there is no traffic noise. I would have to agree with the comments made about the rooms - sad, small, old fashioned, nasty - but we didn't go to Rome to stay in the room. All told there were 18 of us on a 50th birthday trip, and it was excellent for that - we could meet in the bar (very expensive bottled beer) and sort out our plans together. Breakfast was fine - cold meats and cheeses, and average coffee - but again suited us. Even though it was January, 18 of us ate in the open air with fantastic views of Rome's skyline. The place is too expensive for its facilities, but I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ktfrostie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights, prior to a cruise honeymoon. The location was fantastic, the views from our window spectacular, and we were minutes from the Pantheon. The front desk personelle were always helpful, and the breakfast on the top floor balcony area was perfect. Compared to other European hotels we have stayed at, this one was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: ryanflyin
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent four nights in early January. The hotel is terrific for exploring this beautiful city. We walked everywhere. Located near the Pantheon was a plus making it very accessible to a multitude of little eating spots. The weather was so cooperative we were able to eat outside two nights. The hotel staff was very accomodating. We spent our first night in a very small, noisey room. The next day we upgraded to a beautiful corner room with large windows which opened onto the piazza. Breakfast was included in a lovely room on the top floor of the hotel. In warmer weather there is a roof garden for breakfast. The capuccino was delicious! The CP is a very old building (adds to its charm) and a bit worn, however, it was perfect for our needs. I am very picky about accomodations and found everything to be more than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been a more perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: CouleeCat
Reviews.Content: When it comes to older hotels, I'm convinced your personal experience is directly relative to which room you stay in. My sister-in-law and I stayed 6 nights in a corner room, #447, and couldn't have been more delighted! One window looked out at the Parliment Building and the other onto an Egyptian obelisk. We had 2 twin beds that were a bit hard, but after going full-tilt all day we slept like babies. The room was spacious and had an entry area housing the closets and entrance to the bath. It was very quiet for a city center hotel, probably because of the secured piazza of the parliment building. It was entertaining occasionally during the day when protesters would "address" parliment with their concerns by shouting their list of grievences from behind a small barricade. The staff here was just wonderful. All were extremely nice and helpful. We loved the breakfast which featured hand crafted capuccinos with the little foam heart on top. Besides a large assortment of breads, pastries and cereals, it had scrambled eggs, ham, cheese, boiled eggs, baked apples, fruits and yogurts. If the weather was nice, we dined alfresco and enjoyed the view. The location just couldn't be better.
