A couple blocks from the Pantheon, a couple blocks from the Trevi and certainly walking distance to every major sight. Best yet, Giolitti's, Rome's most famous gelateria was just a few steps away! The front desk will give you a great map to find your way around. If you get lost anyway, you'll only discover another exciting sight that you hadn't planned to visit. We traveled off season, early December, and paid just 800 euros for 6 nights, less than $200 American dollars per night inclusive of all taxes, etc. I booked through the hotels website and checked back often to watch for rate changes. I can't recommend this hotel enough. Our experience here helped make the whole trip absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Location is key”
Reviews.Author: sugarcoatedalmondbliss
Reviews.Content: We did a cruise for our honeymoon and decided to stay a few extra days in Rome. The location of this hotel was fabulous for walking to the sites or catching the bus (directly across the street). The metro was a bit futher out, but not an unpleasant or difficult walk. The room was larger than average by European standards, and the housekeeping staff kept the room spotless. The staff was incredibly accommodating and warm, helping us with finding a taxi, dining, anything else. The staff also spoke English, which was great as the extent of our Italian is "grazi!" We loved the breakfast terrace, and the breakfast was fairly comprehensive which was a nice way to start the day. The negatives? The bed was quite uncomfortable, squeaky, and hard, and the air conditioning didn't do much to temper the 90+ degree heat in June. But perhaps I'm just a big fat American and love my creature comforts. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired but good location”
Reviews.Author: Karchristi
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location, the hotel is rather tired looking and in urgent need of renovation. Our room was comfortable and very clean. They did switch on the central heating but we could not adjust the temperature and needed to have the window open so we didn’t cook! The breakfast was OK, but not a great choice of food and they seemed to be short staffed. I was travelling with my mother and she was concerned about the state of the floor mats in the breakfast room as they curled up and you could easily trip on them. They had internet access in a small booth that was really too small for most people to fit in. We did find the staff helpful and polite. I agree with another reviewer about not letting them recommend a restaurant – we also found that the one they recommended was expensive and the service was very slow. There are many great places to eat especially near the Pantheon. This hotel is probably worth considering even though it is a bit tired, but the location is wonderful as you can walk to Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and lots more.

Reviews.Title: “Colonna Palace was..ok”
Reviews.Author: Goldenchic
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel was excellent, within walking distance of many attractions and restaurants. Do not allow the concierge to book a restaurant for you...we did, and were ripped off by the restaurant. Find your own places to eat or research them before you get there..Also we thought there would be Wi-fi ih the rooms and it was only availalble, for a fee, in the lobby. Very inconvinient. And there is no English TV, not even CNN news or BBC..so the tv in the room was useless. We also did not like that the concierge tried to pressure us into taking a Vatican Tours within minutes of checking in..We had just arrived and were tired from the flight., when we told them we had already booked a tour for a different day, he said he would cancel that tour for us! Ahh-no thanks! We wondered why he was so interested in our taking this particular tour....we would maybe stay here again since the location was excellent, but not allow them to book anything for us...

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: DUSNj
Reviews.Content: It's all about the central location. The staff was friendly, and the rooms were OK. We checked in after midnight, and the room we got smelled of smoke, but since all the rooms were taken there was nothing that can be done. The AC unit was OK, and the TV was the size of a laptop and had only Italian channels. But you're there to see Rome and not to stay in the room all day and watch TV. When we needed late checkout they were able to give it to us without an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JulesInSD
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance to all of the Rome tourist sites. Very pretty rooftop terrace overlooking the city for the typical continental included breakfast. It was about a 1 hour crazy cab ride from the airport to the hotel. Service was acceptable and the front desk gave us great recommendations for a nearby coffee place and for a new restaurant for dinner (Grano, delicious food at a moderate price). We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. Nothing fancy, but, if you are like my husband and me and only sleep in the hotel, then this place is perfect. Clean, newly renovated, small TV with Italian channels. The bathroom floor gets soaking wet when taking a shower. No clock so remember to bring a travel clock or watch.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Villiers34
Reviews.Content: I would endorse all the compliments noted by other reviewers. Our five-day stay at Colonna Palace was extremely pleasant. The staff were uniformly friendly and helpful. Our room was not luxurious but comfortable, and spacious by European standards. Breakfast on the roof terrace was a delight. The location is great, with an abundance of restaurants within waliking distance, as well as most of the main tourist attractions. Only one little niggle - because Parliament Square is closed to traffic taxis cannot get near the front door, which was a minor inconvenience. We would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Elistinka
Reviews.Content: We have booked the hotel directly through their website after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. Best part of this hotel is location. It was absolutely perfect, 3 minutes to Pantheon, 5 mins to Trevi Fountain and 10 mins to Spanish Steps. 20-30 minutes to Colloseum and Vatican. We never used public transportation and walked everywhere. Hotel is located on the Piazza and in very safe location next to the Parliament builiding with 24 hour armed guards. It's also very quiet cause it tucked away on a side street, and we usually slept with our window opened and AC off. Our hotel room was large with a double bed, desk, TV, 2 chairs and a small table. We had a room facing the square which houses the Parliament and the Obelisk, which was very nice. After reading more recent September reviews, it seems like some travelers weren't as lucky as us. Out room was very clean, well air conditioned, and light. AC was working all the time. Bathroom was brand new but still the problem with the half shower curtain where the floor gets soaked... however, it's quite popular in Europe, and every hotel has the same thing. There was a large granite counter in the bathroom to put all our toiletries. We had a mini fridge, full of drinks, but were able to put some of our own drinks or snacks in there. TV had no engish channels but we were never in the room that much so it didn't matter to us. The hotel has a lovely rooftop terrace which is were you enjoy your breakfast or can sit at anytime and take in the views or have a nice cool drink. Our first night we were so jet lag, that decided to stay in the hotel. We went and bought various snacks (olives, pizza, etc), a nice bottle of wine, and had a dinner on the rooftop. Very romantic as we had the rooftop to ourselves. Breakfast was fabulous on a roof terrace with a great view. Breakfast was quite generous with croissants, rolls, yogurt, canned fruits, cereal, cold cuts, pound cakes, juice, etc. Coffee is good and they also make capuccinos to order. Hotel also has a nice front desk with a bar working till 12am with very friendly bar staff. Overall, hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. One note is that the rooftop Jacuzzi was not working, but the bathroom had Jacuzzi which we used. There are lots of choices for lunch or dinner. We ate at a different place every night. The best place was Osteria Romana on Via S. Paolo. Hands down the best restaurant in Rome. Incredible food and service. The owner of the place was having dinner right next to us, and shared later his homemade cookies. Trust the waiter and experience a true roman cuisine - no menu, just choose meat or fish, and be prepared for course after course of delicious food. We must've had 4 different courses plus dessert. Tiramisu and house wine is not to be missed. A true highlight of our trip. To sum up... Loved the location of the hotel, loved the staff and nice clean remodeled rooms. As we slept with our rooms open (it cools nicely in the evening), we would leave for our day of sightseeing leaving the window open. The cleaning staff would make up the room, close the window and turn the AC on so that when we came back in the afternoon for a short rest, the room was very comfortable and we relaxed in a nice cool room before venturing out again. Would absolutely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: RenoRobbie
Reviews.Content: Pro's: great, safe location for being in the middle of Rome. Easy walk to most historical sights. A public bus about 50 meters from the hotel takes you to the front of the Vatican for 1 euro. Very nice breakfast on rooftop with fabulous view. Exceptionally friendly and helpful front desk. Con's: Lobby is dark, worn and smells a bit stale. Furniture could use replacement or at least cleaning. We were on the 3rd floor which had a dark hallway with dusty sconces hanging askew. Our room was small. The furniture was worn and chipped. The headboard was unattached and banged against the wall. Air conditioning was working only part time and regulated from the desk. Not a cheerful room. The bathroom had been remodeled but there was no place to put toiletries or a hook for a robe or towel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall...not a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: USCFanMinnesota
Reviews.Content: After months of pouring over reviews, we finally selected the Colonna Palace Hotel, despite its mixed reviews. We chose this hotel primarily for its location, and in that we were not disappointed. We were able to walk to everything--the Vatican was about a 30 minute walk, the Colosseum was about a 15 minute walk, and, if you don't mind an uphill jaunt, the Borghese Gallery was also within walking distance. It's a block from Giolitti's and there are plenty of restaurants to choose from in the area. Since we're on the positives: I was also impressed with the breakfast included in the room rate. I thought it was quite generous, with enough to keep one full through a good portion of the day. Also, the room was clean upon arrival, and the housekeeping service was very good--we had interrupted them a couple of times unintentionally by coming back to the room midday for a rest. We noticed that instead of leaving the room until the following morning, which most hotels do, they made another visit later in the day after we had gone out for dinner to finish cleaning the room. Toiletries were replaced daily as were the towels--overall very impressed with this aspect of the hotel. Unfortunately, there were two aspects of the room that were deal breakers for us: the air conditioning and the bed. When we got to Rome it was in the 90s and extremely humid. We were very much looking forward to the air conditioned room that had been advertised, especially since we had arrived early and the room had not been ready, so we wandered around outside in the heat for several hours. When we were able to check in, we made an unpleasant discovery. The air conditioning was broken. At first, we thought we just didn't understand the controls, so made a call down to the front desk. We were told that there was a service man at the hotel, and the air wasn't working because it had been turned off so this man could work. We were told it would be up an running in 10-15 minutes. We waited half an hour--nothing. My husband made a trip down to the front desk to check on it. At this point we were told that it wouldn't be fixed until the next day. Even though it was by now dark outside, it had not cooled off at all. The air was hot and heavy, with no breeze. The hotel's suggestion for the broken air conditioning? Open the window. Genius. As if that weren't bad enough, when we did finally lay down to go to sleep we realized that the bed was...old. Very, very old. So old that you could feel each of the box springs underneath you, and they dug into your back, side, whatever you were lying on, from the minute you laid down on the bed until the minute you got up. It also sunk in the middle. It was so uncomfortable that my husband got up in the middle of the night and laid on the floor instead. Needless to say, we did not sleep well at all during our stay here. The air was working by the third day of our stay, but it was one of those wall units that was added later, and it was never able to cool the room down. If you stood directly in front of it about five feet away, you managed to feel a cooler draft, but move a foot or two to the side and you were back in the muggy atmosphere that is Rome. The bed wasn't in line with this breeze, of course. After the first night of being told to open the window (so that the 90 degree temperature outside could cool down the 90 degree temperature inside?), we did not go back down to the front desk to attempt any recourse. Our stay was only for a few days, so we decided rather than try to see if another room (or hotel) was available, just to tough it out. It was unfortunate, because we couldn't wait to leave Rome, not because we didn't enjoy the city, but because we didn't enjoy the hotel. I don't know if every room in the hotel is like this, or if we were just unlucky, but based on our experience, we will never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Haven in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tykissy
Reviews.Content: Date: 16th July 2007 Reviewer: Cruiser from Australia We had a 4 night stay post a Greek Isles Cruise. Our stay here was excellent and would throughly reccommend this hotel to other guests. From the moment you walk in, it is everything you are expecting from photos and information you obtain from reviews and sites like this. Compared to other hotels we considered and saw, as we were with a group of friends that stayed at 3 other hotels in Rome, the Colonna Palace won hands down for its star rating. Space(considering you are in Europe) is one of the attractions, a nice front desk and a very lovely bar, lounge and board room occupy the ground floor. The bar staff were very friendly as were all the staff here at the Colonna Palace. The rooms are very roomy and clean. We had a room facing the square which houses the Italian Parliment House, which was very nice. The square is patrolled by police 24 hours a day which makes the area feel very safe. The hotel has a lovely rooftop terrace which is were you enjoy your breakfast or can sit at anytime and take in the views or have a nice cool drink. The only disappointment was the rooftop Jacuzzi was not working which was one of the reasons I chose to book this hotel and its seems it has not been working for sometime as I had read a review on this site prior to booking that had mentioned the spa was not working but it was awhile ago and after ringing the the hotel when I made my booking, to check that it was working and being told that it was and then arriving and finding out it was not working caused an upset at the time, but it seems it was working when I rang but then they were doing more renovating at the time we were there. Anyway the rest of the hotel made up for any upsets. The hotel is in an excellent area.........walking distance to most attractions. We walked past the Trevi fountain at least twice a day and the hotel is short taxi ride to the Vactican and costs 8 euro or you can get any of the numerous buses that go there. You could even walk there if you are not there in July, as it was just too hot to consider this option. To wrap it up.........a great stay in a great hotel in a great and wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: lkgreen
Reviews.Content: The Colonna Palace Hotel is in a fantastic location in the parliament square. This means that it is in a very safe area as there are always guards outside. It is only two minutes walk from the Pantheon Square with loads of restaurants and bars. We chose to eat there most days as we tried some other places but found these restaurants were definatley the best! Try Di Rienzo restaurant for great pasta. The hotel is within walking distance of all of the main attractions in Rome - 20 mins to the Vatican City and the Colosseum. The hotel is also within walking distance of the bus station (where most of the airport shuttles drop you off) but a taxi is only 8 Euros and you can avoid getting lost like we did! The rooms are fantastically decorated in traditional Italian style with huge wooden shutters on the windows. Everywhere was very clean with a maid service every day. We recommend going to the Vatican City really early as the queues are terrible - also check that the museum and the Sistine Chapel are open before you go as they are closed for certain religious festivals throughout the year. The queue for the colosseum looks worse than it is and tends to move very quickly. Overall we were very pleased with our stay at the Colonna Palace and will definately be going back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustVenice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights and it is nothing spectacular. The room was not impressive, but the bathroom was spacious and the location was great. I would advise against staying here for a honeymoon or anniversary as it is not romantic. It was difficult for us to sleep as the walls are thin and we could easily hear other guests talking late at night. While most of our experience with the reception was positive, we had a strange interaction with one of the staff during checkout, who was rude and abrupt for no reason. Overall, I'd say if you can't find anywhere else in the price range or want to be near the Parliament building, it's okay for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MABris
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in late April. Hotel is directly opposite the Roman parliament building and in quiet central location. Very close to the Pantheon - 3 minutes and less than a 10 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. Very friendly staff who speak english. Rooms are clean. Breakfast on the rooftop has a nice view with both hot and cold food and plenty of choice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome!”
Reviews.Author: WilliamNIreland
Reviews.Content: If, like me, you read the review on this hotel entitled "Would rather have slept on the street," and are panicking because you have already booked and paid for this hotel, I just two words for you - "stop panicking!". I had been warned that hotels in Rome and Italy in general are of a different standard to the rest of Europe, and in fairness, would have to agree. However, if you bear this in mind, and want a very clean hotel, in the best location in Rome, then book this hotel now! The downstairs bar and reception areas are very nice, which makes a good first impression. We had a large modernised room at the front of the hotel, overlooking the Italian parliament , which was spotlessly clean, with a remodelled bathroom. We also had a minibar, with a good selection of well priced drinks. In particular we enjoyed the roof top terrace, with the fabulous views over the city. This was a great place to chill at the end of the day's sightseeing. Breakfast was adequate, if a little repetative. As already mentioned, it really is the location of the hotel which makes it such a star. I still have the blisters to prove that I saw almost every inch of Rome, and can truthfully say that I didn't see anywhere else that I would have preferred to stay. We walked easily to all the main attractions, meaning that we didn't have to use public transport at all. It was great to be relaxing on the roof top at night and then just nipping across the road (literally!) to the Trevi fountain (wonderful!). The entire staff are also lovely - you definately couldn't ask for nicer. If you are looking for a really nice meal for a special occasion, try "Osteria dell Ingegno", in Piazzo de Pietra, which is very close to the hotel. Its expensive, (but not outrageously so),and is a real treat. If you are a shopper, the Via del Corso, is a few steps away, but I also loved the small shops in the streets surrounding the hotel. Another good shopping street (affordable) is Via Frattina near the Spanish steps. Across the river, near the Vatican, is a nice department store called "Coin" and I thought the shops surrounding it where proabably the best. My best tips: 1. Try the Vatican museums at lunchtime - we did so on a Thursday, and there were NO queues! - make sure you don't miss the Sistine Chapel - breathtaking!. 2. For a change at lunctime, visit a little deli at Trevi fountain, which sells great salads, sandwiches etc etc as well as chilled drinks and an incredably cheap rate. Bring them back to the hotel's roof terrace and chill! 3. Don't get the Terravision bus service - total chaos. The hotel will arrange a door to door service for 49 euro inclusive of all supplements. A little more expensive, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sherylwithans
Reviews.Content: The Colonna Palace Hotel is in a great location. it's a little hard to find though. Our travel agent had booked us a car from the airport to the hotel and the driver couldn't find the hotel (doesn't help that it's impossible for a car to get to the front door anyway) and dropped us off pretty far down the street. Our room was obviously recently renovated and nice and clean. Breakfast was decent. rooftop seating was nice. front desk people were very helpful about booking tours etc. In fact, when we were leaving they couldn't call a taxi for us (# was busy) so they bellhop helped us carry our bags to a nearby taxi stand (probably 2 blocks away). I'd stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: toffblue
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel in an excellent location. If you get a room at the front (I can't speak for the back of the hotel) there is minimal noise which is a luxury in Rome, as you are facing a pedestrianised square. It is in the perfect location to be able to walk to all the Roman attractions. We had one slight problem with noise from room next door but that was solved promptly by reception.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: dkr1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonna Palace for 4 nights. As others have indicated, the location is amazing. The Pantheon is about a 3 minute walk away, and Trevi Fountain is about 5 minutes away. There are a lot of restaurants just outside the hotel. Because of the central location, we walked everywhere and never had to take public transportation during our trip except to get back to the airport. The Forum/Colosseum and the Vatican are a little further, about a half hour to 45 minutes on foot, but we enjoyed the walk. Walking is agreat way to get to know the city. Although not outstanding, the free breakfast each day was a plus, and the breakfast area on the roof overlooking the city was a great way to start each day. The area is very safe at night, the Itallian Parliament is next door so their is a continuous police presence. I would definitley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Would rather have slept outside”
Reviews.Author: mwillett
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonna after a cruise and although we had 3 nights booked we checked out after 1 night. The other reviews are right, the staff are ok and the location is ok but the hotel is very substandard. The rooms have no a/c and no ventialtion, the bathrooms are old and dirty, the room is old and unclean. There is no restuarant and the "American Breakfast" you can include in your room rate is a scoop of scrambled eggs if you are lucky. We paid nearly $500AUS p/n for this and checked out the day after we got there. For a few hundred dollars more we stayed at the hilton in a suite overlooking the city from a hill which was a far more pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mahlerfan
Reviews.Content: I spent three days at this hotel in the heart of the Historic district. My stay was a very pleasant experience. The staff was very polite, fluent in English and the room was reasonably priced, quite comfortable and roomy by European standards. I was particularly impressed with the central location: two or three blocks from Trevi and the Pantheon, a quarter of a mile to a half mile from the Forum and Spanish steps. I also enjoyed the complimentary breakfast on the hotel's rooftop terrace overlooking the city. I'd certainly consider staying here again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great accommodations, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2306
Reviews.Content: We loved the CP. Stayed for 3 nights w/ my family. The rooms were cozy and spacious -- small by U.S. standards but plenty big for an average urban European hotel. The location was primo, in the same piazza as the parliament building. The CP is literally steps from the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps, etc. It is walking distance or a 5 Euro cab ride from the Colosseum and the Forum. It is surronded by iconic, windy cobblestone streets filled with restaurants, shops, and gelaterias. As they say, location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: LEMV
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location! The desk staff deserves an A+. Each staff member was accomodating, courteous and extremely warm and friendly. The only complaint I have is the lack of air-conditioning. The temperatures ranged from 25-28C, therefore it was necessary to have AC. We were forced to sleep with the windows opens; except it was a little too noisy. I would definately return again. Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet piazza, incredible location!”
Reviews.Author: maureenospdx
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights and will return for another stay next trip because the location was fabulous. Just a short walk to most major sites, and 1 piazza away from a taxi stand should you need a ride. There were many wonderful restaurants minutes away for fabulous dinners at the end of the day. The room was clean and the newly remodeled bathroom beautiful. We had a corner room with 2 windows overlooking the pedestrian piazza. I give this a 5 for location and cleanliness...although the mattresses and pillows were a bit hard. The roof top terrace was a wonderful place to start the day. Internet access available downstairs for those quick messages home telling everybody what a great time we were having in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: TerpTraveler55
Reviews.Content: The best parts of this hotel are the location and the lobby. After that, things go a little down hill. The hotel is undergoing renovation and it caused some inconvenience. We stayed on a floor that did not have elevator service and it was a pain to have to go up to the 4th floor and then walk back down to our room. Our room also faced the back side overlooking a small street and the noise from the street was unbelieveble at times --- such as the extremely noisy trash truck making its pick ups at 2am!! Our view was of the construction scaffolding. The roof top terrace for breakfast is nice, but it seemed that everyone that sat outside needed to smoke with their breakfast. The food was awful at best. A couple of mornings we had what resembled scrambled eggs with some kind of meat mixed in (maybe bacon, maybe ham). Room temperature hard-boiled eggs were the safe bets for breakfast. Very weak, machine pumped orange juice was there to wash it all down. For the price, this was a big disappointment. The staff was not all that friendly and when we complained about the room situation, they were not overly eager to help. Please note, they did try to help, but made us feel guilty for complaining. This is a great location, but be warned about the construction and the noise (major construction noise started at 6:30am one morning!!!). You could definitely find a better stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for a hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: brtoy
Reviews.Content: We just spent 6 nights at the Colonna Palace. We booked 3 rooms with a party of 6 and were pleased with all rooms. Rooms were very clean and spacious with a view overlooking the parliament building. The hotel still is undergoing some room renovations, but work is done during the daytime so as not to disturb sleeping at night. We had a little street noise, but only if there was a scheduled soccer game. Breakfast was served each morning on the rooftop terrace with a fantastic view of Rome. A couple of days we took our own lunch and had some evening nightcaps on the terrace. Can't beat the view and there's no cover charge for seating. Great location to all historical sites with plenty of restaurants nearby. Friendly, helpful staff. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessK100
Reviews.Content: You couldnt get a better location! We are just back from Rome having celebrated my 40th birthday. We stayed at the Colonna Palace for 3 nights and thought it was a lovely elegant hotel. The location is perfect and is only 4 mins walk from the Pantheon and 5 mins from the Trevi Fountain. The hotel is currently having some refurbishment done to part of it but we didnt experience any inconvenience. We had a lovely room on the 5th floor which had good views over Rome. The breakfasts were good and weather permitting, you can enjoy your morning cappuccino on the rooftop terrace. The staff were very helpful, especially Pierro the barman, who recommended two very good restuarants which were situated close by to us. The hotel is situated directly opposite the Parliament and with police present 24 hours, we felt very safe. We had a fabulous time in Rome and the Colonna Palace made it very special. We will definately return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AlPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with our party of 4 adults and 4 children. The hotel ensured that our 3 rooms were altogether. We had a great stay. The view from our room was very nice. The rooms were spacious (though old) and the location of the hotel is wonderful, being able to walk to most sites was great - especially with 4 children in tow! I would definitely stay here again. (The breakfasts were also very good here and desk staff very helpful).

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful New Year in the Eternal city”
Reviews.Author: quasargal
Reviews.Content: The reviews for the hotel drew us to this lovely hotel. We then watched for a great deal from our travel agent for New Year and in May 06 just such an offer came up. So we snapped it up immediately and got our great deal. We arrived in the 28th of December and stayed for 7 nights including New Year’s Eve. We always book a twin room so when they showed us a double bed room we turned it down. They then offered us a lovely room overlooking the Parliament Building, but unfortunately there was only a single wardrobe and two shallow drawers in the bedside cabinets, and we had 40 kilos of luggage for a week’s stay. So back to reception and finally they gave us a lovely twin room with a dressing room, bathroom, its own hall area and a large sized bedroom. All this was done with the minimum fuss with no bad attitude or long faces from the hotel staff, who were great. The room was on a side street, which was a bit noisy in the day but quiet at night. It was a little dark but then it was wintertime with short days. Occasionally you could get CNN but could not guarantee it would be there, so you got fed up with nothing to watch on the TV. The bedroom was a little tired in décor and so was the bathroom, but it was clean and well supplied with fresh linen every day. The breakfast room is small and the breakfast was adequate, however you expect to get more than the only friut being tinned peaches and tinned prunes in a 4 star hotel. If you could eat wheat you were ok but there was no facilities for toast or anything cooked except for 1 inch squares of cooked egg omelette or a hard boiled egg. There was absolutely no variety from day to day and it was poor fare in a 4 star hotel, and the tiny tables soon filled up. In the summer you could sit on the roof terrace, but even though the weather was very warm, we were told to come inside by the staff as the tables were dirty. The famous roof terrace is ok but the view is of rooftops and TV aerials. The hot-tub on the roof was old and disconnected and a great section of the roof was like a builder’s yard. However the staff are the greatest asset to this hotel. Piero has given us details of a wonderful place to visit on our next trip to Lake Garda in July. I recommend the hotel but It is no longer 4 star however expect 3 star and you will be happy. The location cannot be bettered and it is just 100 yards from Giolitti’s, the best ice cream makers in Rome. Near this I also recommend the Zio Ciro restaurant opposite the Church of the Maddelena. 3 nights a week they have a free jazz combo and they offer more than just make pizza whilst you watch in there wood burning oven. The grilled pork chops are to die for. The food is hot as is the jazz !! There is lots to do at New Year with concerts, events and the Befano fair for the children in Piazza Navona. I will go again to the Hotel Colonna Palace without hesitation, and the New Year weather was very warm with bright blue skies on 5 of the 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel more than any we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: GiovannainIowa
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Colonna Palace Hotel for nine days from late December, 2006 to January 5, 2007 and we hated to leave. Absolutely everything was perfect. From our warm greeting by Francesco and Piero at the front desk to the kindness and good humor of Pietro in the bar, to our other new friends from the hotel--Mauritzio, Stefano and Andreas--this felt like a stay with friends or family, not a stay at any old hotel. The location could not be more perfect. It is literally a few blocks' walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, and a few blocks in the other direction to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The room was huge and had a beautiful newly-finished marble bathroom, an incredibly comfortable bed and the breakfasts were spectacular. Views from the room, from the front of the hotel, and from the rooftop terrace were stunning. The hotel opens into the piazza of Montecitorio--the Italian Parliament building is just in front of you and there is no auto traffic, so the hotel is unbelievably quiet. We just couldn't imagine a more lovely spot from which to enjoy Rome. We will always return to this wonderful hotel. Joan and Carolyn, Iowa City, Iowa

Reviews.Title: “A find”
Reviews.Author: Hainsey
Reviews.Content: I spent a great deal of time on trip advisor and hundreds of other web sites looking at hotels, rooms, comparing prices, etc. I finally decided on this hotel as being in my price range and convenient to various sites. I was not disappointed. It is located in a small courtyard behind an embassy. The room was small but adequate, the bathroom fine and all very clean. A highlight was the terrace overlooking the city where we had our breakfast and frequently met up with our fellow travelers for a drink (there is not bar up there, we brought our own) The bar on the first floor was small but good and the bartender was great with great recommendations for dinner, very friendly. I was introduced to Proseco there. The staff was very accomodating but, in truth, most of our time was spent out and about the city. I would recommend this highly for its convenience to the Spanish Steps, Piazza Navarone and the Trevi Fountain, its affordability and just general pleasantness. The Vatican is within walking distance if you are a good walker, I'm not, but I did anyway and lived! I loved Rome and was very happy with my accomodations, as were the other people in my group.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mamameatball
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at the Colonna Palace Hotel after completing a 12 day mediterranean cruise. Were were 10 people (5 couples). Having been the one to research and choose the Colonna Hotel, I was a bit concerned after reading some recent reviews. Let me say that my fears were relieved as soon as we walked through the front door. We were immediately greeted by Francesco, the conceirge/front desk attendant. One review I read said that Francesco and the staff were rude and arrogant. Let me state emphatically, that was not what we experienced. All of the staff were friendly and very attentive. We choose the Colonna because we wanted to experience some of Rome's "old world charm" and for its location. Both of these requirements were met by the Colonna. All 5 rooms were different, but all were clean, roomy and made us feel like we were in Rome. The location just can't be beat. You are literally 2 blocks from the Trevi Fountain if you walk to the right of the hotel. I f you turn left at the hotel towards the back and walk 2 blocks, you are at the Pantheon. Walk another 2 blocks, you are at the Piazza Navona and if you continue another 2-3 blocks, you are at the Campa di Fiore. The Colesseum is about a 20 minute walk and so is the Vatican. The Spanish Steps are about a 10 minute walk if you go straight down Via del Corso and make a right on Via Condotti. Lots of shopping, pretty pricey. It is true that there is renovation going on at the hotel. It is supposed to be completed around February of 07. We were never really bothered by it. (The renovations are the only reason I did not give this an "excellent" rating. If they were not going on, I would have rated it "excellent".) You cannot sit outside in the piazza because of the scaffoling, but the roof top terrace more than makes up for it. The terrace has wonderful views of Rome. We sat there and had breakfast. The wait staff was very attentive and quick to bring us our coffee. The breakfast is buffet style (very good) but a full "American" breakfast is available if you want to pay for it. We stayed up on the terrace one night and watched the sunset and just enjoyed the fantastic view. The piazza it is located in is very safe as there is some sort of government building across from the hotel and there are policemen there 24 hours a day. One of the days we were there, the governor was visiting so the soldiers did some sort of"changing of the guard" thing. We will definitely stay at the Colonna the next time we are in Rome as will all of our travelling companions. It is a little pricey but worth it. It was agreed by all that the Colonna Palace Hotel was a great way to cap off a wonderful 2 week vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Baillie2
Reviews.Content: we loved this hotel. We were there for 9 nights with two friends and they made sure were were all on the same floor. the service was kind and competent. There was an elevator that was small but v. efficient. Our air conditioning worked fine but our friends had a bit more trouble.. their room was definitely warmer than ours. It wasn't horrible, just sometimes warmer in their room. We all agreed that the location was perfect and that the rooftop patio was a major highlight -- beautiful and it had a small dip pool on it that was perfect to cool off in. you could have your (reasonably priced) beer or bottle of wine brought up to the patio by the friendly staff, even late at night. the view of the city was amazing. Breakfast was always the same but the rolls were always fresh and the coffee hot and tasty. The bartender, Pietro, was so terrific and he recommended a restaurant to us that ended up being our favorite. I know i've already said it, but the location was SO great. You could go out in the morning, head back to the hotel to cool off and have a rest at lunch, and still have an entirely full afternoon. All without taking the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mayte1027
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 days at the Colonna Palace and we were very happy. The rooms are small but we were thrilled with the location and the hospitality. The roof deck was perfect for breakfast each morning and the view from up there was breathtaking. I loved the fact that we were right across the street from the Parliament building. The police were every where and I had never felt more safe in my life. The front desk was so helpful with directions and suggestions for dinner. They also made sure that my husband and I had a boxed breakfast on the morning that we left for Florence. I am a meeting and event planner and I have stayed at many hotels and I would highly recommend this hotel. We can't wait to go back to Rome and we will stay at the Colonna Palace again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Excellent Breakfest”
Reviews.Author: Coldmaac
Reviews.Content: The Colonna Palace Hotel was perfect for me between June 28th to July 10th… Let me explain 1.Everything is within walking distance. Head South West and in 3 mins your at the Pantheon, From the Pantheon Head West, for 5 mins and you’re at Piazza Novona, 2 mins South from here you will end up at Camp De Fiori or if you choose to go North West for 7 mins from Piazza Novona you will end up at Castel Sant’ Angelo, 6 mins West from here you will end up at Basilica S. Pietro. If you choose to go East from the Hotel for 4 mins you will end up at Trevi Fountain. Again from the hotel if you head South for 10 mins and you will end up at Capitoline Hill, 2 mins south from here and your in ancient Rome. Lastly If you go North for 8 mins then East for 2 mins you will arrive at the Spanish steps.(Bring a compass. The maps in the guides look easy on paper but when your actually there in those narrow streets with no street signs and your looking at the size of the Pantheon it can be confusing which way east or west is) 2. Safety – This hotel is probably the safest hotel in central Rome. There are cops everywhere around this hotel 24/7. Piazza Colonna is a square with all government buildings so there are cops night and day. (No need to do a night tour with a guide there are soo many people out during the night and you could walk to everything within minutes I did the night tour my first day for just safety reasons, but after my 2 weeks I felt it was a waste of money) 3. Free Breakfast buffet – I stayed there for 13 days and the spread was pretty good. They had croissants, cold cuts (very fresh), cheese, sponge cake, hard boiled eggs,eggs cooked with bacon (I don’t know what it was called), Bread rolls with 4 jams type, peaches, apples, watermelon, Amazing coffee (I didn’t even missed my Tim Horton’s) Cappuccino, Tea, Hot chocolate, Orange juice and pop. (This saves you a few Euros each day which by the end of 2 weeks adds up to 100’s of Euros saved for 2 people) 4. Shopping – This hotel is in the Shopping District step out the door 1 min East your on Via de Corso Street go North and shop till you drop. There is Zara, Diesel, Energie, Miss Sixty and a lot of clothing stores down this street go all the way North you end up at Pizza Del Popolo (u know your there when u see the obelisk) now head down South to Via Del Babuuino and you will find Gucci, Prada, Fendi, Armani etc, etc… ( I suggest you go in the 2nd week of July or 2nd week of January. Major Sales up to 80 % off, I got some Armani glasses for next to nothing & Energie was like 60 % off) 5. Service – was 5 stars all the way, We had a huge bed (2 doubles pushed together) with very soft clean sheets, the beds where very comfy, there was no noise, room had AC, Bar fridge and a TV. The washroom was good. I always placed a towel on the floor because when the tiles got wet the floor was extremely slippery. The Décor is dated, there is no restaurant in this hotel (they do have a bar though) and the TV didn’t work. But who cares. However if you’re the type that loves to stay in your hotel during your vacation and prefer to pay 30 to 50 euros for your breakfast, and pay more per night for a modern look, and don’t like to eat out and finally love to take taxi’s or even the metro with the Europeans to get to a main site then this hotel brother is not for you. By the way if you have never been to Bangkok then you really don’t know what a 5 star hotel is really like. 6. TIPS – there are so many restaurants by Piazza Novona to try out, our favourite was the Big Apple great prices for great food. It’s the middle street on the west side of the P. Novona. If your going to eat at a restaurant outside by the Pantheon or Campo De Fiori you will have to pay a lot for the bread they give you and you will be charged a service charge just for sitting – you can refuse the bread as I always did and you wont be charged. Also if you go by the Pantheon you will see a Mc Donald’s there (facing the McD’s go left down the street and on your right you will see a grocery store buy your water and beer there take it back to the hotel put it in you bar fridge and enjoy) or if you prefer pay 3 Euros for a water bottle then that’s your choice :) Ive read 5 guides about Italy and Rome the best one is from Frommer’s Rome Day by Day I did everything in this book and was totally satisfied with it. Lastly arrange the airport transfer to and from this hotel it only cost 42 euros which is a steal. Hope this helps, Have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Location Makes the Difference”
Reviews.Author: Quatquatta
Reviews.Content: One would struggle to find a hotel with a better location. Everything one would want to see is within EASY walking distance. Sites, shopping, restaurants are just outside the front door. The rooms are spacious and clean, however, they are basic. There is double glazing to keep out noise and some rooms were being rennovated during our stay - a good thing. The breakfast is substantial, the coffee over breakfast particularly impressive, but you'll only notice this once you get over the spectacular views from the dinning area! The staff are friendly, however, they are none too bright - 60% of information provided was correct, however, which 60% was hard to determine. We would stay here again without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistant, not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had two, three night stays in May, 2006. One room was fine and service fine. The other room was terrible and in a horrible state of repair and no amount of requesting could get simple things fixed, like hot water that wouldn't turn off, loose rattling locks, falling molding, etc. TV was without English news most of the week, with no response other than a shrug. Completely surrounded by building reconstructions. Don't plan to sleep past 6:30 am, 6 days a week. Location is fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Debba9802
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Colonna Friday, March 31, 2006 for one night as an extension to a business trip. Luxury and 5 star amenities are not what I look for in a hotel. Location, cleanliness and safety are most important to me and I found all three at the Colonna for an excellent price ($125 USD on Expedia). The room was a single and yes, it was small but I didn't spend much time there. The bathroom and bathtub were clean and adequate. I don't know what type of TV stations were available because I never turned the TV on. The weather was perfect at the end of March so AC was not needed. Keeping the shuttered windows open let in a very nice breeze. The surrounding area seemed quiet to me but I am used to city noise. The staff was also professional and very courteous from check in to check out. Check in did not take long. The staff provided maps and sight seeing advice and then I was escorted to my room. I would especially like to mention the man (didn't get his name) who was working at the front desk later that night. He went out of his way to arrange my airport transportation for the next morning. While I was out sightseeing I saw a 24 hour airport shuttle advertised on a billboard for 27 euro. He called the number for me but unfortunately it was already booked. There is also an airport service offered by the hotel for 42 euro. This was booked too so he recommended taking a cab to Termini (about 15 - 20 euro) and then taking the train to the airport (about 10 euro). He even went on the internet to print out the train schedule for me - definitely 5 star service! When I checked out in the morning, he was still working and called a cab for me. I am a young, single woman and felt very safe staying at the Colonna and walking in the surrounding area. The location is EXCELLENT - within walking distance of many tourist attractions (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Piazza Navona). I took the metro to the Colosseum and walked back because the weather was beautiful - and I stopped along the way for dinner and gelato. I also walked to the bars at Campo de Fiori that night (about a 15 min walk). One suggestion about arriving by cab: Piazza di Montecitorio is difficult to get to because of all of the narrow cobblestone streets (if you can even call them streets - they are more like allies). I would recommend telling the driver to go to Via del Corso (large main street) and Largo Chigi. There is a plaza (not sure of the name) with a tall pillar and a fountain in front of it (see the picture) on the west side of Via del Corso just south of Largo Chigi. If you walk to the right of this (straight back), you will run directly into the Piazza di Montecitorio and the Colonna will be on your left.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: roslynpines
Reviews.Content: Colonna Palace was the perfect spot for us. We paid very little to upgrade our package deal to the Colonna. As two sisters traveling with an eleven year old we felt safe and secure. The hotel is traditional and old fashioned but very clean. Since we had a triple there was space to more around (unlike the reviews for singles). The sheets were pressed and the towels big. Breakfast on the roof was a wonderful way to start the day. Directly across from the well guarded Parliment. A short walk to many major attractions. If you can get a good price and like an old world feel, do not hesitate to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Memories of the Colonna Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Colonna Palace for 5 days in September of 2005, and I really did enjoy it. It is a very nice hotel, and decorated in good taste. At first I thought the room (a single) was a little small, but it turned out to be plenty for me. Traveling alone, I felt extremely safe there with the Parliament and State buildings next door. The staff made me feel very welcome and took good care of me. I especially enjoyed the rooftop garden with nice views of Rome and of other rooftop gardens, and where breakfast is served in the mornings. The location is perfect. It is within walking distance of practically everything you want to see. I can't wait to go back and see the hotel and the staff again.

Reviews.Title: “my second great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this lovely charming hotel. It's worth the stay for the beautiful roof top terrace where we had breakfast with a fantastic view of the city and the church bells ringing out over the city. It's a great location, v.quiet at night and within walking distance of lots of sights and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: eurofrog
Reviews.Content: The Colonna Palace boasts four stars, and I think that is exactly why I am disappointed with it. What is indeed of four, if not five star quality, is its location, right in the middle of the historic centre, less than five minutes from the Pantheon or the Trevi Fountain, and just a stone's throw from Via del Corso. So the Colonna Palace gets full marks for location. The staff was friendly and efficient, but not to a greater extent than should be expected from a supposedly high class hotel. The breakfast terrace is, indeed, magnificent and has great views of Rome's roofs and church towers, but the quality of what one is offered to consume for breakfast in this grand location is, unfortunately, best not spoken of. (I know Italy is not a country that is reknowned for its breakfast, but I have had much better elsewhere in Rome and Italy.) The lobby, bar and reception areas are also very nice and look like an old 'palazzo'. However, once you get to the floors with the rooms, the glamour decreases. Corridors and rooms alike were in urgent need of renovation, as was the bathroom. However, the place was clean. A fellow traveller compained of noise from the streets, which is imaginable, given the single glasing windows, but I had no such problems. However, as indicated above, while I can't say that anything was seriously wrong with the Colonna Palace, I just didn't think that it got anywhere near four star quality. I have travelled quite a lot in Spain, where four stars usually guarantee a much higher standard, so I was disappointed to find a hotel that was only OK. Value for money is, in my view, nothing the Colonna Palace stands out for - on the contrary. Would I stay there again? Yes, probably, if I got a good, cheap deal. Definitely not if the standard room rate was charged (or indeed anything above 120 euros for double room per night).

Reviews.Title: “Colonna Palace was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Colonna Palace last week for 4 nights. He had never been to Europe so I "prepared" him for small rooms and "european showers"....well once we got there, he thought I was crazy! Our room was very big, bigger than some of the W hotels we have stayed in the states! The location is also VERY quiet, we live in NYC and were not used to it being so quiet while we slept! haha We had a big bathroom w/ a normal shower (great water pressure too). We're both young (29) and I have travelled alot and can tell you this hotel was really unbelievable and very reasonable in price. The hotel is in a perfect location, 5 minutes to everything. The room was very clean and nice and I cannot even tell you how AMAZING the rooftop terrace was for breakfast. Nothing really impresses my fiancee and even he was in awe. You sit and have a great breakfast and have a view of Rome that is priceless. We were there in Nov and the weather was incredible. We ate outside everyday. I highly recommend this hotel and will definately go back when we visit beautiful Rome. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: 62Racing
Reviews.Content: It amazes me that Colonna Palace is getting bad reviews. I just stayed there from September 16 to the 21. Lobby area was beautiful, staff were more then helpful, they give you a map when checking in and point out all the major tourist sites. Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc not more then a 10 minute walk in any direction. Hotel is located directly across from the Parliament Building with law enforcement outside 24 hours a day making your stay feel even safer. I stayed in a single room (due to a very loud snoring travel mate), single bed that was adequate, floral print draperies, desk, tv (which included CNN World News everyday) and bathroom with shower. Air conditioning was always working although it didn't really cool the room down enough. Beautiful oak finished woodwork with shutter windows. If you do open the windows of course you are going to get street noise, you are in Rome for crying out loud! Breakfast was lovely sitting on the roof garden terrace overlooking the V.E. Monument and rooftops. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome and stayed 3 nights at the Colonna Palace. Good location. Disappointed in bathroom - no water pressure, in fact the water dribbles out and sometimes stops. When we inquired about air conditioning we were informed they would look into it. We did not have air conditioning during our stay. Wanted to check on some rumors we heard on the streets regarding terrorist attacks, but there was not one TV station in English. When we inquired about CNN we were informed that it was not available that day - but it wasn't available any day! Newspapers in hotel only in Italian. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one”
Reviews.Author: Panoptes
Reviews.Content: I shave stayed here twice. The first time I had a reasonable room - small but it had all the amenites, and the location is fantastic. I returned 2 years later. This time I was given a terrible room at the top of the hotel. Air conditioning was turned off, but the street is too noisy to sleep with open windows. The staff are rude. I will not return, there are plenty of better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal base”
Reviews.Author: Wifelet
Reviews.Content: Having been to Rome before, I knew that having a hotel in the right location is key to an enjoyable trip. I picked this hotel for exactly that reason, and found that we were never far from anywhere we wanted to go. Dated? Definitely, but when you are selecting a hotel for a trip to Rome, the main criteria has to be location, as you really do not spend that much time in your room. When we were in our room, we opened up the shutters and had a wonderful view of Rome's terracotta roof tops, with the Vitriano monument in clear sight. We had hot water for a well earned soak, clean towels, and a lovely roof top terrace breakfast to set us up for the day with. If you want sleek and polish, this isn't for you. Strangely thats what I normally lean towards, however, I do try to pick my accommodation based on the type of trip I'm on, so for a 3 night trip to Rome, this was ideal for us.

Reviews.Title: “Colonna Palace Hotel - Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in late July and did not like the hotel. Staff was nice, but this place is in bad need of a facelift. Great location to see Rome, but beds are poor and rooms are dated. Would not go back until they put some serious money into the place!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is quite possibly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff was rude. Our room was extremeley small and dirty. We had a skylight and no window. This is not the charming hotel that others have described. Well I take that back . If you consider a room without working air conditioning, a terrible mattress, a staff who doesnt seem concerned with your comfort, and if you enjoy shimmying through a partially open bathroom door (its obstructed by the sink) all while paying almost double what the Hilton costs charming....then enjoy your stay. I only wish they would let me post the video of my room here. It is truly unbelievable !! Say hello to the nasty woman at the front desk for me !!!

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Italy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Italy was wonderful..in part because the colonna palace was such a great hotel. We stayed in room 445...Wow!! what a room.. large great beds etc. The staff was helpful and freindly. The view from the roof was excellent. Want a good place to stay....Here it is. Rich & Rob

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a convenient price through Reservationitaly.com and spent 5 days in Rome staying at Hotel Colonna Palace. We visited the most important sights of Rome by a short walk. The rooms are quite spacious although not luxurious. The breakfast was good and various. Excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As noted in previous reviews, this is a comfortable place with good, friendly service and a reasonable breakfast buffet. The rooms are ok, although the furniture and decor is a bit old. The location next to the parliament building does make it a safe and well-patrolled area, and it is within easy walking distance of many of Rome's interesting attractions. It is difficult to get here by car and I can't imagine where one would park, but then I can't imagine wanting to have a car in Rome anyway. Just realize that the cab driver will take you on a whirlwind tour of many back allies in an attempt to get here. This ride will also be very expensive; you're much better off going downstairs at the airport and hiring one of the livery services for half the price. The hotel clerk will also be very helpful in arranging for a reasonably-priced ride back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, large room, superior staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location with little street noise (if you face the front) because it is in a pedestrian precinct. Rooms are large by European standards and have much more closet and drawer space than hotels in other European cities. Included breakfast buffet was adequate but not special. The desk staff was friendly, extremely helpful and completely bilingual (English and Italian). We 'suffered' three stereotypical Italian problems during our stay--hot water was tepid one evening, electricity went off in our room one evening because someone in adjoining room used the hair dryer too long and the phone did not work one evening. Location featured dozens of restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk and great gelato 200 yards away. When we return to Rome we will definately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Terrace”
Reviews.Author: Kriselda
Reviews.Content: This is great value - I stayed here at the beginning of January, 2005 with my husband and 3 children. The breakfast terrace was fabulous - worth staying just for this! Caught the lovely warm sun and we had views over the rooftops of Rome. The location is also great - just a few minutes walk to Trevi, Piazza Navonna, Pantheon. Staff varied from officious to lovely. One recommended a nearby restaurant strongly, so I suspected the worst - it turned out to be perfect, family friendly and reasonably priced. Rooms are not huge (it IS Europe, after all) but certainly bigger than the usual! The only problem is if you are driving into Rome, as we did. There is no parking at the front, and we couldn't find any nearby - just a warning!
